commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator.

This includes rpc api namespace support, some minor configuration
related fixes, and the redis based matchmaker for use with impl_zmq.

Change-Id: Ib8d9920e259a1930b7372790d64491c136ced71a

commit_message:
Remove variable substituion to %NUM% to correctly invoke local command

Referencing %NUM% must be a mistake, because with it networks are not
deleted properly. See other commands within quantum-adv-test.sh as
an example.

Fixes bug #1164018

Change-Id: Ib222d82a1b8187167606b2543bb74c28b8465b5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-08 00:49:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttachInterfacesTest error

This commit fixes some issues in AttachInterfacesTest.
* There is a problem to get the return value, TypeError is
  occurring.
* Assign the JSON or XML to _interface, but it is not specified
  in the method.
* Add a process to wait until the "ACTIVE" status.
  Because the status is "DOWN" when a interface is created.

Fixes bug 1164894

Change-Id: I71ec9e46eb15e70f870b7a833d5433fa351c42eb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttachInterfacesTest error

This commit fixes some issues in AttachInterfacesTest.
* There is a problem to get the return value, TypeError is
  occurring.
* Assign the JSON or XML to _interface, but it is not specified
  in the method.
* Add a process to wait until the "ACTIVE" status.
  Because the status is "DOWN" when a interface is created.

Fixes bug 1164894

Change-Id: I71ec9e46eb15e70f870b7a833d5433fa351c42eb

[{'created': '2013-04-09 09:54:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix to create an image with given  min_ram value.

Currently the create_image() method creates an image by setting
'min_ram' value to zero.When create_image() is asked to create
an image with different 'min_ram' value say '40' it ignores this
and still creates the image with 'min_ram' value set to zero.
This fixes Bug #1166675

Change-Id: Ie90ec93c04b538dc9cb991e6836727a507c9eb00
"}, {'created': '2013-04-12 10:10:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix to create an image with given  min_ram value.

Currently the create_image() method creates an image by setting
'min_ram' value to zero.When create_image() is asked to create
an image with different 'min_ram' value say '40' it ignores this
and still creates the image with 'min_ram' value set to zero.
Also adding a new test named "test_register_image_with_min_ram"
just to make sure that create_image() indeed creates an image
with the given 'min_ram' value.
This fixes Bug #1166675

Change-Id: Ie90ec93c04b538dc9cb991e6836727a507c9eb00
'}]
commit_message:
Fix to create an image with given  min_ram value.

Currently the create_image() method creates an image by setting
'min_ram' value to zero.When create_image() is asked to create
an image with different 'min_ram' value say '40' it ignores this
and still creates the image with 'min_ram' value set to zero.
Also adding a new test named "test_register_image_with_min_ram"
just to make sure that create_image() indeed creates an image
with the given 'min_ram' value.
This fixes Bug #1166675

Change-Id: Ie90ec93c04b538dc9cb991e6836727a507c9eb00

commit_message:
Fix to use an API to get the default quota set

Current test_get_default_quotas uses 'os-quota-sets/{tenant_id}'
API.
Now each tenant quota value is tested, but default quata value
has not been tested.

Fixes bug 1167190

Change-Id: I167d430ff923a7c1e54f371ec4b4afe5acca8b1d

commit_message:
Add fixed ip client and tests

This adds fixed ip tests for nova fixed ips extension.
Partially implements bp missing-tempest-tests

Change-Id: Ie43875591938dbff7482389fe114123ece600e20

garyk, mordred: I have a nit on your review comments regarding using locals() - please explain why it's a bad idea and/or point to where this decision is documented (it's not in pep8 or HACKING).  The intent of the flake8/hacking patches is to get away from reviewers having to provide recurring mechanical feedback, and I'd like to have that be an ongoing process rather than a one-off."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-14 23:40:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

gongysh: The hacking's support for enforcing import ordering isn't smart enough to handle multiline imports yet, and the nvp plugin was previously using multiline imports due to to the long paths of many of its modules.  Since the secondary directory was completely unnecessary, I used hacking compatibility as the motivation to do it."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-04-14 23:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Enable automatic validation of many HACKING rules.

 * Add hacking to the tox build - a set of flake8 plugins that
   perform automatic validation of many HACKING.rst rules.
 * This patch configures hacking in the tox build and performs
   the mechanical cleanup required to allow the checks to pass.
 * See https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hacking

Change-Id: Ie9b3eb5627a9b6dd181f79225abae422e6cf3777

commit_message:
Add coverage-reset command to reset Nova coverage data.

Add a new command coverage-reset to enable users to reset
coverage data.
This also adds unit tests on coverage-reset command.

Fixes bug: 1164331

Change-Id: I101e38165206224927d8ce32c8663a8d9403450b

Also the error happened in the middle of the initial resize operation which led me to suspect that the confirm_resize was actually a spillover from a previous test.

[{'created': '2013-04-11 14:24:36.000000000', 'message': "Catch TypeError exception to avoid setting instance to ERROR state

In libvirt driver, if an instance for some reason is missing a disk,
then calculations in get_disk_over_committed_size_total() throws a
TypeError: int() argument must be a string or a number, not 'NoneType'
exception that may cause the instance to end up in ERROR state.

An example of this happening is in test case test_resize_server_revert
as detailed in the below bug report.

Resolves bug 1161529.

Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0
"}, {'created': '2013-04-11 23:24:13.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure confirm_resize finishes before setting vm_state to ACTIVE

Setting it to ACTIVE to early will allow new resize or whatever
operations to start before this one has finished which might result
in all sorts of conflicts.

Resolves bug 1161529.

Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0
'}, {'created': '2013-04-11 23:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure confirm_resize finishes before setting vm_state to ACTIVE

Setting it to ACTIVE to early will allow new resize or whatever
operations to start before this one has finished which might result

Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0
'}, {'created': '2013-04-12 22:15:39.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure confirm_resize finishes before setting vm_state to ACTIVE

Setting it to ACTIVE to early will allow new resize or whatever
operations to start before the current confirm has finished which
might result in all sorts of conflicts.

Resolves bug 1161529 where an intermittent failure in a tempest test
happens because a confirm operation conflicts with a later resize
carried out on the same instance. As the new resize starts to move
around instance disks, the still not finished confirm operation might
fail at recalculating total disk usage due to a missing disk.

Other possible conflicts might be due to system_metadata and/or quota
not being up-to-date at the moment the instance becomes ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure confirm_resize finishes before setting vm_state to ACTIVE

Setting it to ACTIVE to early will allow new resize or whatever
operations to start before the current confirm has finished which
might result in all sorts of conflicts.

Resolves bug 1161529 where an intermittent failure in a tempest test
happens because a confirm operation conflicts with a later resize
carried out on the same instance. As the new resize starts to move
around instance disks, the still not finished confirm operation might
fail at recalculating total disk usage due to a missing disk.

Other possible conflicts might be due to system_metadata and/or quota
not being up-to-date at the moment the instance becomes ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I079da4e271469739504fa87e23149d03652d98f0

[{'created': '2013-04-09 21:53:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add rpc method namespace support.

RPC endpoints already had the ability to expose multiple APIs ... sort
of.  You could pass multiple callback objects to the dispatcher and it
would check all of them for a method call.

This patch adds the ability to set a namespace on a callback object.
This makes exposing multiple APIs a bit more like you would expect it to
work.  You can invoke a method on a specific callback object, as opposed
to having it check all of them for the method.

This will allow you to create, manage, and version APIs without any
potential conflicts with other APIs being exposed by the same endpoint.
An example of where I would like to use this is in Nova, where we have
some methods that we would like to expose on *all* rpc endpoints.

Implement blueprint rpc-multi-api.

	******* NOTE FOR IMPORTING INTO A PROJECT *********

Note that this patch includes a public API change.  The make_msg()
method of the rpc.proxy.Proxy class takes a new required argument:
namespace.  Existing usage of Proxy.make_msg() must be updated for this
change when importing this change.

	***************************************************

Change-Id: Ief4433e2e1c32cfb05b4cd27b87fe32b40f4341d
'}, {'created': '2013-04-12 14:43:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add rpc method namespace support.

would check all of them for a method call.

This patch adds the ability to set a namespace on a callback object.
This makes exposing multiple APIs a bit more like you would expect it to
work.  You can invoke a method on a specific callback object, as opposed
to having it check all of them for the method.

This will allow you to create, manage, and version APIs without any
potential conflicts with other APIs being exposed by the same endpoint.
An example of where I would like to use this is in Nova, where we have
some methods that we would like to expose on *all* rpc endpoints.

This includes no public API changes and is fully backwards compatible.

Implement blueprint rpc-multi-api.

Change-Id: Ief4433e2e1c32cfb05b4cd27b87fe32b40f4341d
'}]
commit_message:
Add rpc method namespace support.

RPC endpoints already had the ability to expose multiple APIs ... sort
of.  You could pass multiple callback objects to the dispatcher and it
would check all of them for a method call.

This patch adds the ability to set a namespace on a callback object.
This makes exposing multiple APIs a bit more like you would expect it to
work.  You can invoke a method on a specific callback object, as opposed
to having it check all of them for the method.

This will allow you to create, manage, and version APIs without any
potential conflicts with other APIs being exposed by the same endpoint.
An example of where I would like to use this is in Nova, where we have
some methods that we would like to expose on *all* rpc endpoints.

This includes no public API changes and is fully backwards compatible.

Implement blueprint rpc-multi-api.

Change-Id: Ief4433e2e1c32cfb05b4cd27b87fe32b40f4341d

subject: Pass data from handle_create() to check_active()
messages:
[{'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-03-05 20:21:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What are all the wrong reasons?  Seems like passing data that is local to the resource instance up the stack violates layering principles.  Further it complicates the implementation of the resource which must now maintain a separate state subclass."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-05 20:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23597/1/check/gate-heat-pep8/2311 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23597/1/check/gate-heat-python26/2286 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23597/1/check/gate-heat-python27/2285 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23597/1/check/dev-heat-coverage/956 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-03-06 02:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have to admit this and the dependant patch make it
 more complicated to figure out what's going on. It
 also assumes a lot about the data that needs to be
 passed about.

 I prefer self._activating and friends."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-03-06 10:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Seems like passing data that is local to the resource instance up the stack violates layering principles.

I would turn that around: it seems like storing data that is local to the create() call in the Resource object for anyone to access violates encapsulation principles.

Passing the data through the caller may seem a little odd, but I don't think it's a bad design per se, because the interface guarantees that the subclass has sole responsibility for the data and the caller is completely transparent to it. (I'm sure we've all done something similar in C with a void* pointer. On the other hand if you saw a C++ subclass declaring member data for the purposes of moving information from one method call to the *very next method call*, you would probably be rushing to remove it too.)

> What are all the [usual] reasons?

State is bad in general because it makes it hard to reason about the code. Methods do different things at different times depending on how the object was created and what operations have been performed on it before. Ick. If all the state a function requires is passed in as parameters, then we need not look outside of the function to figure out what it does. (It's also easier to test, for the same reason.) Obviously some balancing is required, but this is one thing that IMO clearly need not be stored as object state.

> Further it complicates the implementation of the resource which must now maintain a separate state subclass.

This greatly simplifies the implementation of the individual resources. (I'm afraid I don't understand the reference to a "separate state subclass".) If you look at the patch that implements this for the instance resource, the code is now much closer to what it was before splitting check_active() off from handle_create().

The current code puts the onus on subclasses to manage the lifecycle of the data, and every resource type that uses this feature will need to implement this. By contrast, passing it through the caller automatically limits its scope (both in terms of access and time) to exactly the sphere in which it is meaningful (the create operation), and means no subclass need duplicate any part of the implementation.

> I have to admit this and the dependant patch make it more complicated to figure out what's going on.

I agree with this, mainly because of the state that we are still storing in the GroupedInstance class, which has all of the problems that this patch is trying to avoid, and then some. There are a couple of things that I think justify this:

First, the autoscaling resources are a bit of a special case because they abuse the Instance resource to create a "resource" that isn't managed by a stack. All other resources gain the benefit of becoming simpler.

More importantly, this is only a temporary situation. The plan is to turn Resource.create() into a co-routine, so it will effectively be it's own little state machine. This patch ensures that none of the co-routine's state will ever leak to the outside world. The Autoscaling resources will kick off the create co-routine for each instance in handle_create() and return a list of the co-routines. Each call to check_active() will be passed this list, and will continue to advance each co-routine toward completion.

So this will enable the Autoscaling resource to manage the progression of its constituent instances in exactly the same way as a stack will manage the creation, in parallel, of its constituent resources, with all state remaining perfectly encapsulated.

FWIW, I am happy to not commit the next two patches until I have written the rest of the series if that helps keep the ugliness out of the code base. The total series will comprise:

 1) Pass the handle_create() result to check_active() (this patch)
 2) Use this mechanism to pass data in InstanceGroup/AutoscalingGroup
 3) Use this mechanism to pass data in Instance (the ugly one)
 4) Change Resource.create() into a co-routine (will remove ugliness)
 5) Create resources in parallel

(5) should not happen until the Havana cycle. If (1) is going to happen it needs to happen in the Grizzly cycle, since it changes the API for resource subclasses (i.e. plugins). I am completely relaxed about when (2)-(4) are committed, so the Grizzly/Havana release could appear anywhere after (1) and before (5).

> It also assumes a lot about the data that needs to be passed about.

This patch doesn't assume anything at all about the data that needs to be passed about, beyond the fact that there _might_ be some. Subclasses are completely free to ignore or use this in any way they wish.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-03-06 16:21:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Few thoughts, basically I agree with most of the point already made:

- This is coming far too late in the Grizzly release cycle, all this parallel-launch stuff (interesting as it looks) should be proposed as a BP for Havanna, if we keep merging patches related to this feature, we're breaking the feature freeze IMO.

- This pattern looks really wrong, as pointed out in previous reviews, check_active should just read self.create_data IMO

create_data = self.handle_create()
    while not self.check_active(create_data):

In general, I think state-machine *logic* should be handled in the resource base-class, but state *data* can and should be stored on a per resource instance basis

IMO we shouldn't be passing stuff around between methods in a class as arguments which is instance-scope data anyway - intuitively it just makes sense to encapsulate the object and its state together."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-03-07 07:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have to agree with the stated goal of keeping resource subclass methods as state-free as possible. We want resource plugin writers to write stable, tested resources, and that does help reason about the code.

My original onus for doing parallel create of instance was not scaling groups, but all resources. The graph that we walk now treats "creating" the instance and "the instance being active" as the same point on the graph. The trouble is, creating the instance depends on whatever instances are ref'd/dependsOn'd, while things like volume attachments actually need the instance to be active. If the two things are ever far apart in time, they should be split out in any resource.

I agree with Zane that passing in the last clue from the create process will make the coroutines inside the resources easier to reason about and test. And I agree with the general sentiment that this API change would be better in Grizzly. But we're late in Grizzly, and I think its too disruptive to start making API changes at this phase. Lets get this done in H, and try to make sure that resources written for G can still work in H even with changes like this.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:45:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

We decided in our meeting today that we would hold this create state changeset until Havana.  Assigning -2 so it won't pass the gate."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-22 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-22 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-09 21:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored

Restoring this now that development is open for Havana - it is an important step toward getting all resources created in parallel.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-09 21:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-09 21:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 19:58:42.000000000', 'message': 'Pass data from handle_create() to check_active()

Practically all resources that implement check_active() will require some
state to be retained from the call to handle_create(). Saving this as state
in the Resource object is a bad idea for all the usual reasons. Instead of
encouraging this, pass the (previously unused) return value from
handle_create() to check_active() as a subclass-defined piece of state.

Change-Id: I9d690b44a066aaf33970562a2b9a55c633a7d4e8
'}, {'created': '2013-04-09 21:16:03.000000000', 'message': 'Pass data from handle_create() to check_active()

All resources that implement check_active() will require some state to be
retained from the call to handle_create(). Saving this as state in the
Resource object results in repeated, ugly, and potentially error-prone
code.

Instead, allow a subclass-defined state object returned from
handle_create() to be passed to check_active(). This ensures that the state
is limited in scope to where it is meaningful (during the create
operation), and that it will be garbage-collected at the appropriate time,
even if an unexpected exception occurs e.g. because a thread is cancelled.

Change-Id: I9d690b44a066aaf33970562a2b9a55c633a7d4e8
'}]
commit_message:
Pass data from handle_create() to check_active()

All resources that implement check_active() will require some state to be
retained from the call to handle_create(). Saving this as state in the
Resource object results in repeated, ugly, and potentially error-prone
code.

Instead, allow a subclass-defined state object returned from
handle_create() to be passed to check_active(). This ensures that the state
is limited in scope to where it is meaningful (during the create
operation), and that it will be garbage-collected at the appropriate time,
even if an unexpected exception occurs e.g. because a thread is cancelled.

Change-Id: I9d690b44a066aaf33970562a2b9a55c633a7d4e8

commit_message:
Fix the "Updated" field in the Image Detail page

The "Updated" field in the Image Detail page always says
"Never Updated". It appears that the code is looking for
"updated_app" instead of "updated_at".

Fixes bug #1168613

Change-Id: I2582e76f80cfd37c46910b1d419489268bddb0f3

The compute_api.unrescue() call makes direct database queries, which means
it can't be called directly from compute manager. This patch adds support
in conductor for proxying this request and makes compute manager utilize
it.

Fixes bug 1167619

Change-Id: I158c64cabdfe436462f5669047fb930819a13c50
"}]
commit_message:
Make compute/manager use conductor for unrescue()

The compute_api.unrescue() call makes direct database queries, which means
it can't be called directly from compute manager. This patch adds support
in conductor for proxying this request and makes compute manager utilize
it.

Fixes bug 1167619

Change-Id: I158c64cabdfe436462f5669047fb930819a13c50

Adjust nova config for baremetal

- remove AllHostsFilter

before reset-nova can be called successfully.

commit_message:
Use nova rootwrap config directly from source distribution.

Rootwrap config should never need environment-specific modification,
so it can be copied directly from the nova source distribution in use,
instead of duplicated in this tree as config templates.

Change-Id: I59cbbbd1bc871111a59366e6b052be7d310bd743

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-13 18:16:04.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Bug 1121605

This patch replaces nvp_controller_connection the configuration option
with a set options more intutitive to user which also avoid unnecessary
repetitions in ini files.

In order to simplify the configuration of the plugin, this patch also
removes named clusters. As the plugin supports a single cluster at
the moment, this can be simply specified in the [CLUSTER] configuration
section.

Also, this patch restrucures nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

Change-Id: I1699f6fb791a178c3cd9adb3fc452c4775496af9
'}, {'created': '2013-04-13 18:16:04.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Bug 1121605

This patch replaces nvp_controller_connection the configuration option
with a set options more intutitive to user which also avoid unnecessary
repetitions in ini files.
Also, this patch restrucure nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

The change ensures backward compatibility with folsom-style ini files.
Warnings will be emitted in the log for deprecated options.

Change-Id: I1699f6fb791a178c3cd9adb3fc452c4775496af9

commit_message:
Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Bug 1121605

This patch replaces nvp_controller_connection the configuration option
with a set options more intutitive to user which also avoid unnecessary
repetitions in ini files.

In order to simplify the configuration of the plugin, this patch also
removes named clusters. As the plugin supports a single cluster at
the moment, this can be simply specified in the [CLUSTER] configuration
section.

Also, this patch restrucures nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

Change-Id: I1699f6fb791a178c3cd9adb3fc452c4775496af9

OpenShift Origin images require a lot of packages. So, although the OpenShift
Origin HEAT template can be adapted to run with JEOS images, they would take
> 25 min to spin up. Instead, I have opted to create heavier images to speed up

Change-Id: I371d28a9833a48a6b588f907cce3298b30552e90
'}]
commit_message:
Updated OpenShift template

OpenShift Origin images require a lot of packages. So, although the OpenShift
Origin HEAT template can be adapted to run with JEOS images, they would take
> 25 min to spin up. Instead, I have opted to create heavier images to speed up
machine creation. @See https://github.com/sdake/heat-jeos/pull/49

Change-Id: I371d28a9833a48a6b588f907cce3298b30552e90

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,
I am not sure how this actually resolves the problem when one is unable to delete a namespace (this seems to be a known issues that has been reported a number of times). Please see comment #5 (https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1155092).
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (5 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (5 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

None of methods proposed works when namespace is deleted with "Device or resource Busy", however namespace can be successfully deleted later, after state is resynchronized (in fact, after other ip netns commands are executed). That could be some system-level bug or specific behavior.

Current solution is a kind of workaround that allows reusing the pool (since pool id is used to generate a namespace name)

You can the script that reproduces the issue on devstack and see that this patch successfully fixes the problem.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for updating.
Maybe we should consider the ns_cleanup name to be changed to cleanup. Some drivers may not support namespaces and this could confusing...'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Right now the state of namespaces to clean-up is not preserved if the lbaas agent is restarted.  Quantum has a separate utility quantum-netns-cleanup that we should update to properly cleanup orphaned lbaas namespaces."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Mark, the purpose of this change is to delete namespaces of existing pools, not any qlbaas namespace which left for some reason. 
Cleanup is good, but what happening now just makes pool unusable unless deleted/recreated.
I think updating quantum_netns_cleanup is a separate task.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

commit_message:
Delete namespace which may be accidently left
after Vip deletion

fixes bug 1155092

On unsuccessfull deletion namespace is put in a list
and is deleted after device synchronization occurs.

Change-Id: I99a77cc135576e1270eefd8211fe204c8b3fc72b

Hi Sergey - Typically the DocImpact tag in a commit message is used so that the doc team can track a new doc bug and possibly assign it to the original author. In this case, the DocImpact flag indicates docs are already written. I don't think this is the original intent of the flag. Here's how it's meant to be used: 
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/HowTo#Using_the_DocImpact_Flag_in_a_Commit_Message"}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-04-13 03:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This will lead some incompatibility, I think we can keep it until find a better way .'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-12 12:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

bodepd: 

I tried this on Fedora 18 and it seems to work fine.

Couple of inline comments in addition to those below:

1) Would we do this to the other stackforge puppet modules as well? I would love for our _config resources to be consistently used. If we aren't allowing DEFAULT here it seems like we shouldn't allow it to be used in keystone/glance/cinder/quantum,etc modules either.

2) Is our goal to eventually move towards DEFAULT/*? If that is the case this seems like a step backwards...

Just trying to understand where we are heading and keep the modules consistent as much as possible."}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-04-12 21:16:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

I'm stopping this for a second. I should probably do it the right way and break backwards compat."}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-04-13 03:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I have abandoned this change in favor of the following patches:

Iae71a4c4
Ie7a9103b
Ibb60b18d'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 19:35:59.000000000', 'message': "fix purging for nova_config

Previously, nova_config attempted to allow instances identified
by either DEFAULT/setting or just setting (where DEFAULT is implied).

This was intended to allow backwards compat (b/c nova used to not allow
DEFAULT) and also to support the new way of doing things.

This approach was fundamentally flawed b/c it expected instances
found on the system's namevars to match both of these variations
which is not possible.

This patch resolves the issues with the following:
- Do not allow instances of the form: DEFAULT/setting
- Munge queried instances and remove DEFAULT (so they match the names of
the specifed resources so purging works)

Change-Id: Iad09afdfe932c1dd096c17ea10964115c3536827
"}]
commit_message:
fix purging for nova_config

Previously, nova_config attempted to allow instances identified
by either DEFAULT/setting or just setting (where DEFAULT is implied).

This was intended to allow backwards compat (b/c nova used to not allow
DEFAULT) and also to support the new way of doing things.

This approach was fundamentally flawed b/c it expected instances
found on the system's namevars to match both of these variations
which is not possible.

This patch resolves the issues with the following:
- Do not allow instances of the form: DEFAULT/setting
- Munge queried instances and remove DEFAULT (so they match the names of
the specifed resources so purging works)

Change-Id: Iad09afdfe932c1dd096c17ea10964115c3536827

It's not mistake (it's escape percent). This is intentional for formatting string in two steps. 
For example:
a= '%(n1)d__%%(n2)d'
b= {'n1':1,'n2':2}
c = a % b
# first replacement
print c      ---->    1__%(n2)d
# second replacement
print c % b  ---->    1__2"}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2013-04-11 20:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry, that is normaol example:

a= '%(n1)d__%%(n2)d'

b= {'n1':1,'n2':2}

c = a % b 

# first replacement 

print c ----> 1__%(n2)d 

# second replacement

commit_message:
getLogger should be called after logging is configured

logging needs to be setup properly before we try to log
something. Fixed one spot from logging->LOG

Fixes LP# 1161038

Change-Id: I87743cff9062e47c1d5e989c2c0c05c3921b65c7
(cherry picked from commit 3a106f7e67e4b7f7c446058b98c33f8c71ca2868)

commit_message:
Mark sql_connection with secret flag

sql_connection contains the password in some setups and marking as
secret prevents accidental logging

fixes bug 1160680

Change-Id: I3704237d0923bb30138b5ece7e5c7bbda0a78b9b
(cherry picked from commit 9f8ee9d2981c5f317139e3743385b59956546d65)

'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-03-08 07:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

+1 on exposing this out. 1 minor nit/performance in common.py.

Another option would be to have the controller add a OS-EXT-MACADDRS filed to the server document and have it be something like:

    {'server':
         {'OS-EXT-MACADDRS: {'public': 'aa:aa:aa:aa:aa:aa',
                              ...},
          ...}

Not saying switch to this, just throwing ideas out there since the os_api wasn't really designed with more than 1 network in mind, and we've had to do much bolting on to make it work. This would save another round of iteration.

Luckily the quantum api is much saner displaying network information so we don't have to jump through such hoops ;)."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-03-08 07:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add an extension to show the mac address of a ip in server(s)

This extension adds the OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr param
so that users can associate the mac address to the ip of the server in
one API call.

Implement bp: os-ext-ips-mac-api-extension
DocImpact

Change-Id: I01d0b3aa804b5218853a4bb568c85e31b87d04e4
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Get driver type from base image type.

If we are using the raw backend (no cow), we should set the driver
type based on the type of the source image instead of always
using raw.

Calls to to_xml were moved after _create_image so that the image
type could be determined when creating the xml for libvirt.

Fixes bug 1163009

Change-Id: Ic8d5f0ab83d868a42f834d39c0afb64818d7e027
(cherry picked from commit 494a3cb5749d52aa90daeacd980362df5f971c0d)

[{'created': '2013-04-05 17:09:38.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve conflicting mac address in resize

This patch fixes bug 1161226 and mac address conflicts when migrating or
resizing an instance using the PowerVM driver. This will ensure that if
a migration or resize is taking place on the same host, a temporary mac
address will be assigned to the original LPAR so there is no conflict on
the VIOS when a second LPAR is started with the same address.

Change-Id: I59db484defb789f3a7c0eddbd5ef9e92efc22419
(cherry picked from commit 2a43c4020927c936ed3b3f07416413f5171d62f8)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve conflicting mac address in resize

This patch fixes bug 1161226 and mac address conflicts when migrating or
resizing an instance using the PowerVM driver. This will ensure that if
a migration or resize is taking place on the same host, a temporary mac
address will be assigned to the original LPAR so there is no conflict on
the VIOS when a second LPAR is started with the same address.

Change-Id: I59db484defb789f3a7c0eddbd5ef9e92efc22419
(cherry picked from commit 2a43c4020927c936ed3b3f07416413f5171d62f8)

commit_message:
Ec2Signer: Initial support for v4 signature verification

Adds initial support for verifying AWS v4 signatures, tested with
the latest boto trunk (which now uses v4 signatures by default)

Change-Id: Id163363e259cf08aa251a7a00ff4293b742cbef6
blueprint: ec2signer-v4signatures

commit_message:
Clean up duplicate methods

The identity.core.Driver class had a few function definitions
with the same name. Remove duplicates because it's confusing.

commit_message:
Write last successful metadata over original

If another program is inspecting /var/lib/heat-cfntools/cfn-init-data
after cfn-hup runs, it will now see the updated metadata. This reduces
the complexity quite a bit by having only one local source for metadata.

Change-Id: I82e4bf04ffd2f834a1d3da265d1823c6627ca05a

commit_message:
Count Snapshots towards volume/gigabyte quotas.

Cinder has quotas and limits for volume-count and Gigabytes used,
however we were only counting volumes against these quotas.

This change introduces a snapshot-count limit and also counts
snapshots against this Gigabytes quota allowed for a Tenant.

Fixed bug: 1137927

Conflicts:

	cinder/quota.py
	cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_backups.py
	cinder/tests/test_quota.py
	cinder/volume/api.py
	etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample

Change-Id: Ib9b00b84b05597de9b5725a7f5898fe10a20b9d9
(cherry picked from commit 4b52b1481e3cb6c358252826785228638b0f717d)

commit_message:
Migrate cloud image URL/Release options to DIB_.

This switches $CLOUD_IMAGES and $RELEASE to the DIB_ namespace so
they will survive future changes to the sanitisation of the build
environment.

Change-Id: I7dc2aa82fb9ef452705b080cc404f41046014f20

Allow build dir to be changed from /tmp

Adds an env var TMP_DIR which will override mktemp's default location.

Fixes bug 1168432

Since LOG = getLogger() has been moved from the global scope
to the function scope (main), the rest of the module could

Fixes bug 1165262

'}]
commit_message:
Define LOG globally in baremetal_deploy_helper

Since LOG = getLogger() has been moved from the global scope
to the function scope (main), the rest of the module could
not find LOG. This patch makes LOG global again.

Fixes bug 1165262

Change-Id: I2607802dcbed64135f75011a02ebce95519e4ea1

commit_message:
Catch NoValidHost exception during live-migration

To avoid leaving the instance state as MIGRATING if scheduling of
a target host fails, add this exception to the list of exceptions
for which the instance task state is reset to None.

Resolves bug 1166771.

Change-Id: I23343091725051624c0eb0b82e9f03a7f9d5f4f4
(cherry picked from commit b5732a454a8221bb98cb6a7241b4d4fc17840c6a)

[{'created': '2013-04-10 13:35:38.000000000', 'message': "After migrate, catch and remove deleted instances

On the host init, starting with a deleted instance which has been
previously evacuated from the host results in an InstanceNotFound
exception. Catch and log this, and then call driver.destroy() so
that the hypervisor driver can clean up the deleted instance.

If we don't do this during host init, it will cause problems during
periodic tasks.

Fixes bug 1155152

Co-authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I979a698b8e739b9335f37b81e789285f91977a8e
(cherry picked from commit 306046c7d5c20454035fcea22ce3efeac1d11cfc)
"}]
commit_message:
After migrate, catch and remove deleted instances

On the host init, starting with a deleted instance which has been
previously evacuated from the host results in an InstanceNotFound
exception. Catch and log this, and then call driver.destroy() so
that the hypervisor driver can clean up the deleted instance.

If we don't do this during host init, it will cause problems during
periodic tasks.

Fixes bug 1155152

Co-authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I979a698b8e739b9335f37b81e789285f91977a8e
(cherry picked from commit 306046c7d5c20454035fcea22ce3efeac1d11cfc)

[{'created': '2013-04-10 13:21:48.000000000', 'message': 'Correct network uuid field for os-network extension

"nova net-list" does not return network uuid even when the uuid is
available, and instead returns only the id. This is because the
"network_dict" function in the extension improperly uses "in" to check
for a Network model object. This also reduces compatibility in the API.

Change-Id: I30d4c8bfa37d89123f35ee8cc7c67f0e819262a7

commit_message:
Correct network uuid field for os-network extension

"nova net-list" does not return network uuid even when the uuid is
available, and instead returns only the id. This is because the
"network_dict" function in the extension improperly uses "in" to check
for a Network model object. This also reduces compatibility in the API.

Fixes bug: 1162409

Change-Id: I30d4c8bfa37d89123f35ee8cc7c67f0e819262a7
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>(cherry picked from commit 9254403281fad200f871c5e6ff052dc79c739d6e)

mode, meaning a list of tuples which causes it to break when passed a
new-style NetworkInfo object.

Change-Id: I2131d9b24045cd7531454b65d97776b11ec3ab02
(cherry picked from commit 948d1fefe6cb1e17c5567d3cf3313e13c16a3d57)

commit_message:
Fix legacy_net_info guard

The existing code assumes that `legacy_net_info` is always in legacy
mode, meaning a list of tuples which causes it to break when passed a
new-style NetworkInfo object.

Fixes bug 1164152

Change-Id: I2131d9b24045cd7531454b65d97776b11ec3ab02
(cherry picked from commit 948d1fefe6cb1e17c5567d3cf3313e13c16a3d57)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 12:58:12.000000000', 'message': "Security groups may be unavailable

Currently all missing security group situations are reported as errors
and exceptions. This is not the case - any user requesting a wrong id
or name can cause it and it's not an issue in Nova. A busy system can
generate a large number of those messages causing unnecessarily high
error count.

This change stops reporting this situation as exception in the logs.

Change-Id: Ide856cbbde2db025b0e2def79652cc6c9b00566b
(cherry picked from commit 7d14d024f0d92cd6f9596596cdcaf3d870ba1839)
"}]
commit_message:
Security groups may be unavailable

Currently all missing security group situations are reported as errors
and exceptions. This is not the case - any user requesting a wrong id
or name can cause it and it's not an issue in Nova. A busy system can
generate a large number of those messages causing unnecessarily high
error count.

This change stops reporting this situation as exception in the logs.

Change-Id: Ide856cbbde2db025b0e2def79652cc6c9b00566b
(cherry picked from commit 7d14d024f0d92cd6f9596596cdcaf3d870ba1839)

commit_message:
Add support for configuring qpid.

Support for qpid which uses dprince/qpid (posted on puppetforge).

Currently requires dprince/qpid 1.0.0 or greater.

Change-Id: Iaad3ce107314865ba2f1e620ed7e7e445c73a2db

[{'created': '2013-04-11 15:27:25.000000000', 'message': "improve handling of an empty dnsmasq --domain

Currently all domains passed through the dnsmasq --domain option,
are single quoted.  It's not fully understood how dnsmasq handles
single quotes in this situation, so it's safer to just avoid the
--domain option in this case.

Fixes bug: 1161506
Fixes bug: 1167447
Change-Id: I8ecd996676189f53908abd48fee81132091ee820
Cherry-picked: 24b9731af34fbc2fb17c849cb8cdb5c7a10db77d
"}]
commit_message:
improve handling of an empty dnsmasq --domain

Currently all domains passed through the dnsmasq --domain option,
are single quoted.  It's not fully understood how dnsmasq handles
single quotes in this situation, so it's safer to just avoid the
--domain option in this case.

Fixes bug: 1161506
Fixes bug: 1167447
Change-Id: I8ecd996676189f53908abd48fee81132091ee820
Cherry-picked: 24b9731af34fbc2fb17c849cb8cdb5c7a10db77d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-11 23:38:16.000000000', 'message': 'Replace metadata joins with another query

Right now, we always join metadata and system_metadata when we query for
instances. This inflates the number of rows returned by a factor of ten
at a minimum, and over 30 in some situations. This patch avoids the
direct join of these tables in favor of a "manual join" which performs
additional queries to fill the needed data. Latency may be increased,
but with the gain of a potentially significant amount of reduction in
data transfer.

This also provides the ability for the queries which utilize it to
selectively decide whether either or both of these additional fills are
performed, paving the way for future high-level optimizations.

Related to bug 1164737

(cherry-picked from c3568f9a1a28b269d88d2dcc175e6b5a2f7abf37)
Change-Id: I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9
'}]
commit_message:
Replace metadata joins with another query

Right now, we always join metadata and system_metadata when we query for
instances. This inflates the number of rows returned by a factor of ten
at a minimum, and over 30 in some situations. This patch avoids the
direct join of these tables in favor of a "manual join" which performs
additional queries to fill the needed data. Latency may be increased,
but with the gain of a potentially significant amount of reduction in
data transfer.

This also provides the ability for the queries which utilize it to
selectively decide whether either or both of these additional fills are
performed, paving the way for future high-level optimizations.

Related to bug 1164737

(cherry-picked from c3568f9a1a28b269d88d2dcc175e6b5a2f7abf37)
Change-Id: I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9

The resource tracker is the only consumer of this method and does not
need the joins.  This optimization will save many unnecessary rows from
being fetched during the update_available_resource() audit task.

(cherry-picked from e8449460334de7632887c8685658a8dfc3d3a5b3)
Change-Id: I414c219e4563634e270007fe3d0fa980b273e795

commit_message:
Optimize resource tracker queries for instances

instance_get_all_by_host_and_node() had 4 different joins being done.
The resource tracker is the only consumer of this method and does not
need the joins.  This optimization will save many unnecessary rows from
being fetched during the update_available_resource() audit task.

(cherry-picked from e8449460334de7632887c8685658a8dfc3d3a5b3)
Change-Id: I414c219e4563634e270007fe3d0fa980b273e795

[{'created': '2013-04-12 16:43:13.000000000', 'message': "Populate boot-stack's service catalog with VM's IP.

Keystone's service catalog was populated with 'localhost',
making nova/glance/keystone clients unusable from outside the vm.

This change uses whatever IP address is found on eth0 instead.

Change-Id: Idbbaa74e0235884f2a32fafb16f2ba505e8cc37c
"}]
commit_message:
Populate boot-stack's service catalog with VM's IP.

Keystone's service catalog was populated with 'localhost',
making nova/glance/keystone clients unusable from outside the vm.

This change uses whatever IP address is found on eth0 instead.

Change-Id: Idbbaa74e0235884f2a32fafb16f2ba505e8cc37c

DocImpact

commit_message:
Allow for the power state interval to be configured.

The power state interval right now is hard coded to 600 seconds.
In order to allow deployers to change this timing (and determine)
the side-effects of that change it is useful to allow this value
to be configured instead of static.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9baf34f9b132dc20fcc096f86fa0e5794fc06312

[{'created': '2013-04-12 09:41:27.000000000', 'message': 'Make "private" functions that shouldn't be exported

Currently, the db_api defines some functions that are used for accessing
images data but some of them are for internal use only. In an effort to
improve consistency, I've made some of those functions - the ones that
are not accessed outside the db_api - private by prepending their names
with an "_".

Most of this functions were defined within sqlalchemy and as such didn't
required any change in the simple driver, others though, required a
change in both drivers, i.e. get_session.

This patch implements part of the blueprint registry-api-v2.

NOTE: During the review, try to find functions that should be private
and haven't been changed.

Change-Id: I6342dc94ebf2a35d6bc9bd7698b81a94ffa13373
'}]
commit_message:
Make "private" functions that shouldn't be exported

Currently, the db_api defines some functions that are used for accessing
images data but some of them are for internal use only. In an effort to
improve consistency, I've made some of those functions - the ones that
are not accessed outside the db_api - private by prepending their names
with an "_".

Most of this functions were defined within sqlalchemy and as such didn't
required any change in the simple driver, others though, required a
change in both drivers, i.e. get_session.

This patch implements part of the blueprint registry-api-v2.

NOTE: During the review, try to find functions that should be private
and haven't been changed.

Change-Id: I6342dc94ebf2a35d6bc9bd7698b81a94ffa13373

Current ResouceTracker cares only the corresponding compute_node (It is intentional design, I believe). This patch allows ResouceTracker to touch the other compute_nodes and I wonder it makes things complicated. Is it possible to implement the feature out of ResourceTracker? How about ComputeManager.update_available_resource() ?"}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-03-28 07:22:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for review, I thought about it, but the problem with doing it in compute manager is that is the you will need to call resource tracker with a node not known to driver, which will raise an exception on _get_resource_tracker, I'm not sure it was save to remove the exception there. Open for suggestion let me know if you see anyway to implement from Compute Manager"}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-03-28 07:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, I agree with you that resource tracker is scoped to one node but it already loops through compute_node records to get the get the one that corresponds to nodename in scope. Should be pretty easy to purge resource trackers and compute_node records associated with hypervisors no longer there."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-03-29 14:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Fixes bug 1161193

Orphan compute_node records can cause the scheduler to pick
compute nodes that are not handled by driver anymore. This
can happen if you rename your hypervisor_hostname or in a
multi-node support where driver does not support a node
anymore for whatever reason (hardare failure for example).
Logic in compute manager does not cover all the cases since it
nevers compare driver available nodes with db records.

commit_message:
Cleans up orphan compute_nodes not cleaned up by compute manager

Fixes bug 1161193

Orphan compute_node records can cause the scheduler to pick
compute nodes that are not handled by driver anymore. This
can happen if you rename your hypervisor_hostname or in a
multi-node support where driver does not support a node
anymore for whatever reason (hardare failure for example).

Also, removing resource tracker logic to delete nodes since
resource trackers built in compute manager will never accept
nodes not reported by driver

Change-Id: I742d2e81ec0592d952ee5736aa8dce1e5598ef80

commit_message:
Introduce the DIB_ namespace for build-time config.

Document the use of DIB_ as a prefix on environmental variables that can
be overridden at build time.

Introduce the first such variable by migrating IMAGE_SIZE to
DIB_IMAGE_SIZE.

Change-Id: Ie36b734991b913a23f37f2add47d470d7c1576e4

[{'created': '2013-04-12 09:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fedora element allows root to sudo without TTY.

The root user tries to `sudo -u stack`, without a tty,
causing fedora+devstack images builds to fail in Jenkins.

Change-Id: Ia0a7fb315cf9bd17cf250e70dba06363a697c97c
'}]
commit_message:
Fedora element allows root to sudo without TTY.

The root user tries to `sudo -u stack`, without a tty,
causing fedora+devstack images builds to fail in Jenkins.

Change-Id: Ia0a7fb315cf9bd17cf250e70dba06363a697c97c

commit_message:
Adding pagination to the instance views

Modifying the api.nova.server_list() method to optionally handle
pagination.  The method will also work without pagination to
support the many other place than the instance views that continue
to call the method.

Fixes: bug #1046915

Change-Id: I8195f1f2d8922e1722743d7a2d627a8645e8b3bd

The remote address check is the first thing I do in the authorization step (both on TemAuth and on KeystoneAuth). Perhaps it would be interesting to check the remote address later in the authorization process; for example to allow all OPTIONS requests or container syncs by default. 

I would like to get some opinions on this matter, as I'm not sure about the degree in which the remote address should affect the authorization policy."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

I've applied the changes you proposed.

Regarding when the IP address is checked, now it is performed right before checking the referrer:

* On TempAuth this implies that the address check does not affect authorizing of resellers, admins, container sync requests and OPTIONS requests.

* On KeystoneAuth, the address check is performed when the requester identity is unconfirmed. All previous authorization checks are not affected by what the remote address is."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-09 01:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-05 00:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

How's this going to work behind a load balancer?

Consider a standard Swift proxy running with eventlet.wsgi (i.e. the usual setup):

The ACL checker looks at req.remote_addr, which comes from the WSGI environment's "REMOTE_ADDR" variable, which comes from eventlet.wsgi's self.client_address, which is populated by BaseHTTPServer.BaseHTTPRequestHandler's superclass SocketServer.StreamRequestHandler making a call to self.get_request() which gets the value from socket.accept() which returns the (IP, port) pair of the TCP peer.

If you didn't read all that (and I don't blame you; I almost fell asleep typing it), the short version is that req.remote_addr will be the IP address of the other end of the TCP connection. So, if Swift is running behind a load balancer (as it sometimes is), then req.remote_addr will always be the proxy-facing IP of the load balancer, and thus useless.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Added ACL based on remote address

Extension to add authorization based on the remote IP address.
IP permissions can be set with ``.net:`` prefix. Examples are:

    .net:192.168.0.1            - Allows remote address
                                  192.168.0.1.
    .net:*,.net:-192.168.0.1    - Allows all remote addresses
                                  but 192.168.0.1.
    .net:*,.net:-b0:c45::/32    - Allows all (IPv6) remote
                                  addresses except those in the
                                  subnet b0:c45::/32.

Some unit tests and trivial pep8 fixes are also included.

Fixes: bug #634358
Change-Id: I209a16064e26254619eba2ddc946f2a67cc40e34

commit_message:
The headers should be also applied for the segmented upload request.

swift client recently added header command line option, but when large
object (segmented) upload occurs, the headers only used for manifest
file not for the segment. This creates inconsistency problem between
manifest and the actual segment.

Change-Id: I2fb6c339392ee4ce025ac6dd701b6d637ec258d1
Fixes: bug #1159951

remove all applicable grants when role is deleted
(sql/kvs solution only)

commit_message:
Generate HTTPS certificates with ssl_setup.

Extracts common OpenSSL functionality from pki_setup and adds a new cli
command ssl_setup which re-uses this base to generate SSL certificates
for https.

Change-Id: Ia34827583bcdfbd871133250681010e642271f07
Fixes: bug 1155361

Raise VipExists exception in case Vip is created or updated
for a pool that already has a Vip

fixes bug 1158049

I see your point, however I don't think it is easy to objectively characterize "simple mechanical refactorings that have no functional impact" and there is a tendency to take short cuts under this pretext. Hence I feel it's better to go with an approach that requires a bug/blueprint for all code changes. I do not feel that the perceived "cognitive load" is a high price to pay. There are few patches which will fall in this category anyway, and that actually is my concern is that the changes introduced in those patches will be easily missed.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Maru, Fair point. For one, I do trust your judgement! :-) That said, I still maintain that this is fairly subjective and better to have a consistent practice.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Well, from the end user's perspective this might be non-functional, but this is significant refactoring. This is an enhancement over the existing implementation, and any such change should be tracked either against a bug or a blueprint. Happy to remove the -1 if you still think it's unnecessary."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Will the default path of NVP plugin be changed in the document? (though this change keeps backward compatibility) If so, this patch needs the documentation change and it would be better to add DocImpact flag in the commit message (or LP bug/blueprint) to track the change.
I think DocImpact is the easiest way.

The change itself looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The latest patch removes the second directory level as requested.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I see two reasons for launchpad bugs/blueprints - to track functional issues and to provide a place for discussion and documentation of changes beyond what can be captured in code and commit messages.

For non-functional changes that can be adequately documented in code and commit messages, I see no reason to track it in launchpad.  Anybody who has an issue with the change is going to be a developer, and their first point of reference is going to be the repo anyway.  Under those circumstances, putting the same information in launchpad has no value.

I could definitely see the justification for doing as you say and creating a bug if you were concerned that this change could not or was not being sufficiently documented via code and the commit message.  I'm hearing that it should be done 'for consistency', and I think relying on reviewer judgement would be preferable.

But I digress, and will agree to disagree.  Anybody else care to chime in?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sumit:  I don't believe that bug/blueprint tracking should be required for simple mechanical refactorings that have no functional impact, as that will add to cognitive load in Launchpad tracking to nobody's benefit.   I won't ask you to remove the -1, though, as I think it best to gain consensus from other reviewers on this issue for future reference."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sumit: What would be the benefit of filing a bug for a non-functional change such as this, however 'large'?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-12 04:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Shorten the path of the nicira nvp plugin.

 * s+[/.]nicira_nvp_plugin++
 * Backwards compatibility is maintained by importing the
   nicira package as nicira_nvp_plugin in the plugins package.
 * It may be necessary to remove stale .pyc/.pyo files under the
   nicira path after applying this patch.
 * DocImpact
 * Addresses bug 1166307

Change-Id: I241a2a75106398506b01bcb7a6ddbaafa1b7bd30

commit_message:
allows a mgmt user to migrate an instance to a specific host

a mgmt user and use the instance migrate api and specify a host that
they would like the instance to move to.
Fixing migration fake mode.

implements blueprint migration-force-to-host
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/reddwarf/+spec/migration-force-to-host

Change-Id: I97faa71a9b66a7d7e5c8aad0c36d406ad4e55a76

Okay. I'm fine changing this default to 'v2'. But we'll also want to change the default for swift_store_auth_address (which could break someone's setup)

If v2 is the default the swift_store_auth_address should probably point to the keystone API endpoint."}, {'account_id': 1918, 'date': '2013-04-11 14:54:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

swift_store_version first appeared in the Folsom release cycle, with its default version set to 2.

So, since Folsom, anyone keeping the default values would have a broken Glance setup if using Swift so changing the swift_store_auth_address should be harmless in this case."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-11 15:00:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay. My main argument is that what we use for swift_store_auth_address and swift_store_version needs to match. My initial take in this patchset was to be cautious and  leave our default value for swift_store_auth_address alone.

Franois: If I do as you and Derek suggest and switch the new swift_store_version to '2' (which we all agree is the glance default) then I'm also going to change swift_store_auth_address to default to 127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/ (a potentially breaking change, unlikely to break someone in production though)."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-11 15:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-11 15:04:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add swift_store_auth_version to swift backend.

Updates the glance swift backend to support configuring the
swift_store_auth_version setting. The default value for this is '2'
(which matches the glance config file defaults).

As part of this change I am also updating the default value
for swift_store_auth_address to use 127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/ (keystone).
This makes sense because the previous value would have required
us to set swift_store_auth_version by default to 1.

Change-Id: I865712914dd0506b2722ab8da3e1c56d7d9f433a

[{'created': '2013-04-11 10:07:13.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary db call in scheduler driver live-migration code

When the scheduler selects a destination host for live-migration, a db
call is made to get instance_type info for the instance. To avoid the
db call, this should instead call instance_types.extract_instance_type
on the instance.

Resolves bug 1167811.

Change-Id: I2025fdf1d34e70158360ff71e8545c8e3bc6bc80
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary db call in scheduler driver live-migration code

When the scheduler selects a destination host for live-migration, a db
call is made to get instance_type info for the instance. To avoid the
db call, this should instead call instance_types.extract_instance_type
on the instance.

Resolves bug 1167811.

Change-Id: I2025fdf1d34e70158360ff71e8545c8e3bc6bc80

commit_message:
Make keystone config consistent with other elements.

The keystone element had its config seperated into a
seperate element, which was inconsistent with other
openstack service elements.

This change brings it into line with nova/glance/etc.

Change-Id: I37962e22e32a90824f1c91b1fc6a61435b8b83e7

[{'created': '2013-04-12 00:47:43.000000000', 'message': 'Install OpenStack clients outside of venvs in boot-stack.

Trunk nova-client was being shadowed in the boot-stack element
by a nova-client installed via apt-get.

This change installs nova/glance/quantum clients outside of
venvs so that they take precedence.

Change-Id: Iddd7e2319d37723174b7251d095b5e8d61fad0f9
'}]
commit_message:
Install OpenStack clients outside of venvs in boot-stack.

Trunk nova-client was being shadowed in the boot-stack element
by a nova-client installed via apt-get.

This change installs nova/glance/quantum clients outside of
venvs so that they take precedence.

Change-Id: Iddd7e2319d37723174b7251d095b5e8d61fad0f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 13:54:41.000000000', 'message': "Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error

Don't see any reason to construct a list for request_spec['volume_id'].
And it indeed causes problems when the scheduler receives a reschedule
request with such a request_spec.

Fixes bug #1164857

Change-Id: I811e957d5bf9c814165d55ea0042833ea72c8de5
(cherry picked from commit 46b2a7dd3224c4ed00457520b95569442386d273)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error

Don't see any reason to construct a list for request_spec['volume_id'].
And it indeed causes problems when the scheduler receives a reschedule
request with such a request_spec.

Fixes bug #1164857

Change-Id: I811e957d5bf9c814165d55ea0042833ea72c8de5
(cherry picked from commit 46b2a7dd3224c4ed00457520b95569442386d273)

commit_message:
Tweak volume commands

Basic cleanups:
* metadata is one word
* multiple metadata items can be set using multiple --metadata args
* consistent formatting
* do lookups for project, user and volume args
  This requires https://review.openstack.org/26323 in keystoneclient

Change-Id: I9f24867b9c73b9952a9eb9347acd9e393857445f

commit_message:
uses os.urandom instead of Crypto.Random for backward compatibility

Crypto.Random has been introduced by pycrypto 2.1 but in RHEL6 and
derivates you will only find pycrypto 2.0.1

Change-Id: Ib601981b0b8fcb5b3e8fc8761ee05adf7f6574fa

commit_message:
Use nova CLI for network creation

Prefer the "nova" tool over  "nova-manage" for network creation.

Fixes bug 1167657

Patchset adds missing <title> element to Creating Custom Images.
Patchset corrects <productnumber> for <prompt> in Lay of the Land.

Change-Id: Id5d229f530203f361d71ae2c0cd8385297ee3829

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-29 21:59:49.000000000', 'message': "auth_token v3 token uses expires rather than expires_at

The auth_token middleware uses the 'expires' field from the token.
This causes the middleware to fail requests that have a v3 token
with a KeyError because the token doesn't have 'expires'.

According to the v3 identity api spec the field is 'expires_at'.

- The auth_token middleware is changed to use expires_at rather
than expires for v3 tokens.
- Updated unit tests.

Fixes bug 1161633

Change-Id: Ide74ed47aed502b3fd38b16f0db72a3fe649a3e1
"}]
commit_message:
auth_token v3 token uses expires rather than expires_at

The auth_token middleware uses the 'expires' field from the token.
This causes the middleware to fail requests that have a v3 token
with a KeyError because the token doesn't have 'expires'.

According to the v3 identity api spec the field is 'expires_at'.

- The auth_token middleware is changed to use expires_at rather
than expires for v3 tokens.
- Updated unit tests.

Fixes bug 1161633

Change-Id: Ide74ed47aed502b3fd38b16f0db72a3fe649a3e1

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/26678/1/check/gate-python-novaclient-pep8/1407 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/26678/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/18082 : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 1395, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:45:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Having the _info get out of sync with the actual attributes is kind of a trap for the unwary. Resource.__eq__ (in the cases where the resource doesn't have an id) delegates to an _info comparison, which means that an object retrieved with list, changed, and then updated with get would compare unequal to an object retrieved with a list() at the same time as the get(), because the attrs are equal but the _info dict is stale. Another example is limits:Limits, which uses self._info['rate'] instead of self.rate and as such can return two different answers for the same query, depending on how you retrieved it (if you're not sure how that could happen, see the unit test I added- that test fails without my change, even though it's a perfectly logical thing to do).

It also damages discoverability; when I was playing in novaclient, I thought something was broken with my code because I was inspecting _info which was not updating. For consistency's sake, it's kind of ugly to have part of the data updated and part of it not- some other solutions to maintain consistency could be 1) remove the _info  attr completely or 2) instead of calling setattr in _add_details, it might be worthwhile to override __getattr__ and __setattr__ to operate on _info instead of __dict__, or even 3) make _info an alias for __dict__. #1 is a pretty big change, though- quite a few places use _info. #2 is kind of annoying, maintaining a shadow __dict__ doesn't feel necessary. #3 might be okay, it would preserve compatibility with callers while making sure it can't get out of sync.

I'd be happy to implement this in one of the other different ways if that's what you'd prefer."}, {'account_id': 1395, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck bug 1161529'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

No, I have no problem with the code modifications; I just want you to put that explanation in the commit message :)  When someone is browsing the tree at 30,000 feet with no internet access, I want it to be clear to them, just from the message, what problem(s) the patch was trying to solve :)'}, {'account_id': 1395, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1395, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

roger! fixed the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 23:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
make sure .get() also updates _info

Having the _info get out of sync with the actual attributes is kind of a
trap for the unwary. _info is used in preference to the attributes in
many places, and letting it get out of sync means that the method of
retrieval (get() vs. list()) influences the result.

Change-Id: I9d9bf086fa790b811c520b2fa317f95cb1921805

commit_message:
Support force update quota

Once we have additional check when update quota in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25887/, we need provide --force option
when run 'nova quota-update'.

Fix bug 1160749

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib8d94d4eaa846f620abad5fb55017ac3fb0b322a

[{'created': '2013-04-10 19:20:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove storeconfigs from nova::compute.

Updates the nova compute.pp module so we no longer rely on
storeconfigs being present. This fixes a warning that would occur
when using the nova::compute module.

Change-Id: I8ca2a4cb1d82cd770c649ab31f2ad22885e76ff5
'}, {'created': '2013-04-11 20:08:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove storeconfigs from nova::compute.

Updates the nova compute.pp module so we no longer rely on
storeconfigs being present. This fixes a warning that would occur
when using the nova::compute module.

Change-Id: I8ca2a4cb1d82cd770c649ab31f2ad22885e76ff5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove storeconfigs from nova::compute.

Updates the nova compute.pp module so we no longer rely on
storeconfigs being present. This fixes a warning that would occur
when using the nova::compute module.

Change-Id: I8ca2a4cb1d82cd770c649ab31f2ad22885e76ff5

commit_message:
Replication network parameters

- Replication network fields (replication_ip, replication_port)
  support was added to device dictionary in swift-ring-builder script.
- Changes were made to support new fields in search, show and set_info
  functions.

Change-Id: Ife1c363fe80aa67929be94401d3d42fc9e161342
Implements: blueprint dedicated-replication-network

nova::db::mysql.

commit_message:
Remove unused tools/rfc.sh

This has been deprecated in favour of git-review for quite a while now
and was removed from Nova 10 months ago.

Backport of git commit ae4aecdc7e554f78156c91c7c0b2436638bec5eb in
master.

This is a zero risk commit, as it removes something from tools that
isn't used. It also means removing the only GPL licensed file in the
whole of the cinder repository for 2013.1.1 release.

Change-Id: Ic4bfa1aee3a4b6a7588be3678ac033a1b13e2b18

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 14:14:47.000000000', 'message': "Remove multi scheduler.

This patch removes the multi scheduler.  It doesn't provide any value.
The only code that exists here is for passing through requests to the
compute scheduler.  There is nothing that uses the 'default' scheduler.

The only case where this code could have been useful is if it was
patched out of tree.  At that point, it seems easier to just provide
your own scheduler driver that does what you want instead of trying to
patch this one, IMO.

DocImpact: The multi scheduler no longer exists.

Change-Id: I30902d1ce0aa5baef6693dc4a3b1057cccb27841
"}]
commit_message:
Remove multi scheduler.

This patch removes the multi scheduler.  It doesn't provide any value.
The only code that exists here is for passing through requests to the
compute scheduler.  There is nothing that uses the 'default' scheduler.

The only case where this code could have been useful is if it was
patched out of tree.  At that point, it seems easier to just provide
your own scheduler driver that does what you want instead of trying to
patch this one, IMO.

DocImpact: The multi scheduler no longer exists.

Change-Id: I30902d1ce0aa5baef6693dc4a3b1057cccb27841

commit_message:
Implement LB plugin delete_pool_health_monitor().

commit_message:
make stack traces tool find individual traces

previously the tool just reprinted out TRACE and ERROR log lines.
Now make it actually collect up TRACE and ERROR into individual
events which will make it easier to cross reference to tempest
tests.

built additional features around stack trace tooling, making it
simpler to find unique events.

Change-Id: Id1fed3343e79e75da3145b5a9c19820b65a0d548

commit_message:
Create tests for multiple server creation

This tests nova multiple servers creation using min_count and max_count
instance counters and return_reservation_id parameter.

Cause of the new tests this also add min_count and max_count to xml server
client and return_reservation_id to both clients.

Depends on changes:
    Ifaa9910e13614554d1769e71e8eba9587ec5a13b
    I3ca0129086ff1df3a8faa2b3b8bd959c9b74103c
Both on Nova.
Partially implements bp missing-tempest-tests

Change-Id: I4195b26d88632c2e679b7a6e5bd8cf9443d42553

commit_message:
Account Quota Correction

account_quota middleware fails to check if account_info exists
after retrieving it.

Change-Id: I1aa492d3bd713a6bf27e18ef4ec2e29f4cfb694d
Fixes: Bug #1167389

'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-04-11 16:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

thanks Dan. I know it may be crazy to try to remain compat, but I really appreciate everyone trying for now.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-11 17:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dan: Long term I'd like to see us use a proper branching module to support this perhaps. Or perhaps have a policy of supporting upstream + the last release only. I'd hate to see the "codebase" become increasingly littered up w/ support for old version, etc.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-04-11 17:17:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I totally agree with your idea of supporting upstream + the latest only, which raises a question. Is this a 1.9 (havanna) change. I noticed that it ran fine on girzzly without this change.

As an FYI, I'm not quite ready for havana specific things until we get the grizzly release together (which I am trying to wrap up ASAP)"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-11 17:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This change is required for the latest and greatest Swift (Havana)... but doesn't break backwards compat with older version either.

It is an absolute requirement for me to be able to use SmokeStack. (And I had hoped we'd be on a fast track to make that happen.)

I don't like playing "catch up" on the master branch. Lets just stay ahead of the game.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-04-11 18:30:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I totally understand Dan, I'm trying to meet your needs as well as get things settled so that I can cut a grizzly release/branch, then hopefuly things will move faster. also, please feel free to let me know what things are blocking you and I can try to ensure that I test them and get them merged this week."}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-04-11 19:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Fix swift_ring_builder output parsing.

Updates the swift_ring_builder so that it parses ring builder output
from the most recent Swift releases correctly (1.7.6 or greated).

Backward compat for the previous parsing is still supported.

Change-Id: I4263b349310e16f6825960805eb27e4bfe3ff002

models and firmware versions caused driver failures. This patch

commit_message:
Fix incompatible Storwize/SVC commands.

Inconsistencies in the command line syntax between Storwize/SVC
models and firmware versions caused driver failures. This patch
makes commands compatible to fix driver crashes on the V3700 and
controllers with firmware version 6.3.

Change-Id: I51d5b97afa5419cdbf488f9e4e4597d22bb22f20
Fixes: bug 1163754
Fixed: bug 1163964
