revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-04 10:44:28.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: Change node api related to prov_mac_address

Now prov_mac_address is going to be dropped from bm_nodes table. This patch
adjust api to the change.

A user is expected to create a node without specifying prov_mac_address, then add
an interface having the address to the node. However, for compatibility, a user
still can specify prov_mac_address when create a node. In this case, an interface
having prov_mac_address is automatically added to the node.

In response body of create, index and show, "prov_mac_address" field no longer
exists since they are showed as a member of "interfaces" fileld.

Change-Id: I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880
'}, {'created': '2013-04-11 07:31:57.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: Change node api related to prov_mac_address

Now prov_mac_address is going to be dropped from bm_nodes table. This patch
adjust api to the change.

A user is expected to create a node without specifying prov_mac_address, then add
an interface having the address to the node. However, for compatibility, a user
still can specify prov_mac_address when create a node. In this case, an interface
having prov_mac_address is automatically added to the node.

In response body of create, index and show, "prov_mac_address" field no longer
exists since they are showed as a member of "interfaces" fileld.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880
'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Change node api related to prov_mac_address

Now prov_mac_address is going to be dropped from bm_nodes table. This patch
adjust api to the change.

A user is expected to create a node without specifying prov_mac_address, then add
an interface having the address to the node. However, for compatibility, a user
still can specify prov_mac_address when create a node. In this case, an interface
having prov_mac_address is automatically added to the node.

In response body of create, index and show, "prov_mac_address" field no longer
exists since they are showed as a member of "interfaces" fileld.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880

commit_message:
Only start messagebus on RedHat.

This work around is only required on RedHat so use operatingsystem
instead of osfamily.

Change-Id: I85f780753aa9b4d579a62777fe96177daecaf622

[{'created': '2013-04-09 14:46:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix floating IP management from instance panel.

Quantum Floating IP API works with ports ids not instances ones
(opposite to what Nova Network does). So if we want to associate
(disassociate) an allocated floating IP to some instance we must
use the "target_id" (which is a port_id in case of Quantum and an
instance_id in case of Nova network).

Fixes bug 1158596.

Change-Id: Iceba4d8ee74bd58dc1cdbda7668841b0a7eb86f1
'}, {'created': '2013-04-10 16:09:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix floating IP management from instance panel.

Quantum Floating IP API works with ports ids not instances ones
(opposite to what Nova Network does). So if we want to associate
(disassociate) an allocated floating IP to some instance we must
use the "target_id" (which is a port_id in case of Quantum and an
instance_id in case of Nova network).

Fixes bug 1158596.

Change-Id: Iceba4d8ee74bd58dc1cdbda7668841b0a7eb86f1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix floating IP management from instance panel.

Quantum Floating IP API works with ports ids not instances ones
(opposite to what Nova Network does). So if we want to associate
(disassociate) an allocated floating IP to some instance we must
use the "target_id" (which is a port_id in case of Quantum and an
instance_id in case of Nova network).

Fixes bug 1158596.

Change-Id: Iceba4d8ee74bd58dc1cdbda7668841b0a7eb86f1

commit_message:
RHEL/Fedora replicator updates.

The latest RHEL and Fedora Swift packages now include replicator
init scripts.

This updates the swift module to make use of them.

Change-Id: I6d33aa87ebfda390903762e5a3ab45708db27a5e

commit_message:
Only set special_service_provider on RHEL.

Updates the params.pp so that special_service_provider is set
to 'init' on RHEL only. This gets used to startup libvirtd.

This fixes issues using the Nova compute/libvirt module on
Fedora.

Change-Id: I81f6a50a10f8e16e5d54b93724258a977c35d61f

commit_message:
Update keystone fragment to use egg.

Update keystone.conf.erb to use egg:swift#keystoneauth.

This resolves issues in trying to configure keystone with the
latest Swift releases.

Change-Id: Idf160eb143150bed9a9c7081a6900c6169887be8

commit_message:
Add placeholder migrations to allow backports

Inspired by the nova blueprint backportable-db-migrations,
we reserve a range of migration slots to allow for idempotent
and standalone migrations to be backported to stable/grizzly
during the Havana release cycle.

Nova have reserved 10 slots and the historical ratio of
nova:glance migrations is circa 8:1. Hence the thought that
a total of 3 placeholder slots should more than suffice for
the Havana release cycle.

Change-Id: I576be7520f960e4cb4dcc6928035595fab7e459f

[{'created': '2013-04-11 16:27:46.000000000', 'message': "Use guestagent model to validate users.

Because we'd like to know that a username or host
is invalid BEFORE asking the guest agent to find
a user with such a name, this change makes use of
the model to give a 400 before it wastes any of
the guest's time with what would come back as a
404 anyway.

Change-Id: Ib933df055d766b3f4a8945d563dd9364352d94e9
"}]
commit_message:
Use guestagent model to validate users.

Because we'd like to know that a username or host
is invalid BEFORE asking the guest agent to find
a user with such a name, this change makes use of
the model to give a 400 before it wastes any of
the guest's time with what would come back as a
404 anyway.

Change-Id: Ib933df055d766b3f4a8945d563dd9364352d94e9

When creating a network with network-create, DuplicateVlan exception
happens whatever the --vlan option is set. This is because --vlan
option isn't read correctly by novaclient. This patch fixes this

commit_message:
Make --vlan option work in network-create in VLAN mode

When creating a network with network-create, DuplicateVlan exception
happens whatever the --vlan option is set. This is because --vlan
option isn't read correctly by novaclient. This patch fixes this
bug.

Fixes bug 1167779

Change-Id: I3bf0e8d96d995632698f5aa1b1a07ead9e553c70

Current swift middleware does not collect # of requests against
Swift, this patch adds the features. # of requests will be under
the following topics:

    storage.request.get
    storage.request.put
    storage.request.head
    storage.request.post
    storage.request.delete
    storage.request.patch

if the request method is not a standard http request, then the
request will be counted as in
    storage.request.other

commit_message:
Extend swift middleware to collect number of requests.

Current swift middleware does not collect # of requests against
Swift, this patch adds the features. # of requests will be under
the following topic storage.api.request

Change-Id: I1b408d01344c9a986af1278a0b7fe3405051adca

subject: Don't display quantum sec rules with no proto.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 1711, 'name': 'Yun Mao', 'email': 'yunmao@gmail.com', 'username': 'yunmao'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 17:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/23709 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-nova-docs/18003 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-nova-python26/19411 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-nova-python26-rhel6/198 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-nova-python27/19499 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/10731 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/10447 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/16307 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25539/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/9902 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-27 20:09:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I understand the reason for this change though I'm not a fan of it because it hides rules from the tenant :/ . I think the fix might be to fix the nova-pythonclient instead to allow for deleting rules without protocols? What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-27 20:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

arosen:
So... I thought about changing python-novaclient. But using just the Nova security groups API extension it doesn't appear to me to be possible to create rules without protocols. So why show them? They are essentially "external" in this regard (and quite confusing viewed via the Nova API).'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-28 17:41:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As a tenant I'd still like to know that those rules are there. I suppose the edge case is the nova client will let you view them delete them but now create rules with out protocols. I'm curious to hear what others think about this as well."}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-04-02 16:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My gut says if we treat quantum security group rules as "external", we should probably not show any of the rules, instead of just the rules that are not compatible..

Btw, when no IP protocol is specified, what does it mean in quantum? match all protocols?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-02 16:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yun Mao: In quantum if no protocol is specified it means match all of them. Also, I'm not suggesting that we treat all quantum rules as "external". Unfortunately quantum sort of violated the constraints of the existing Nova security group APIs in this regard so I'm not sure there is a better solution in Nova. (AFAICT)

I don't seem to be getting buy in on this... so perhaps we should take the other approach and just make quantum match what Nova does? Given that security groups get exposed via both the OpenStack and EC2 APIs it seems reasonable that Quantum should attempt to provide match the existing paradigms in Nova.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-04-04 03:44:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

FWIW I suggest getting consensus as to whether what Quantum did is the right long term direction.

If it is, we should probably permit it in nova-network too, for now; and we'll need to figure out how to fix existing deployed clients, and finally fix nova-client. (or wait for nova-network to die and be sunsetted)."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-04 13:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Making this a WIP for now.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-11 15:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 16:39:36.000000000', 'message': "Don't display quantum sec rules with no proto.

Updates the quantum security group driver in nova so that it excludes
rules which have no protocol. Nova's security group API always
requires the protocol to be specified. When it is missing it can
cause quirky issues with clients too (novaclient for example).

Fixes LP Bug #1161002.

Change-Id: Iebf9b065ff1e3b59699e6cbbce987f7a54a3f806
"}]
commit_message:
Don't display quantum sec rules with no proto.

Updates the quantum security group driver in nova so that it excludes
rules which have no protocol. Nova's security group API always
requires the protocol to be specified. When it is missing it can
cause quirky issues with clients too (novaclient for example).

Fixes LP Bug #1161002.

Change-Id: Iebf9b065ff1e3b59699e6cbbce987f7a54a3f806

[{'created': '2013-04-10 19:02:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "undefined name" pyflake errors

A number of places tried to use undefined names. This included one
powervm test which turned out to not check anything at all (used
fake implementation of tested method) and needed to be moved.

Make sure that this class of errors causes run_pep8 failure in the
future.

Change-Id: I82ccb63bbc6f6d2b20ecb7f06b2fc22f8f034a33
'}, {'created': '2013-04-10 20:17:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "undefined name" pyflake errors

A number of places tried to use undefined names. This included one
powervm test which turned out to not check anything at all (used
fake implementation of tested method) and needed to be moved.

Make sure that this class of errors causes run_pep8 failure in the
future.

Change-Id: I82ccb63bbc6f6d2b20ecb7f06b2fc22f8f034a33
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "undefined name" pyflake errors

A number of places tried to use undefined names. This included one
powervm test which turned out to not check anything at all (used
fake implementation of tested method) and needed to be moved.

Make sure that this class of errors causes run_pep8 failure in the
future.

Change-Id: I82ccb63bbc6f6d2b20ecb7f06b2fc22f8f034a33

commit_message:
Use a plain dict for Quotas.show method.

This also fixes the XML version translator to convert the strings
to integers.

implements blueprint use-plain-dict-for-quotas-show

Change-Id: I4764313a863e9c1fd0ee8fa00645b57535d47c76

commit_message:
pipeline, publisher, transformer: reorganize code

This move a bit of code to make it less Ceilometer centric.
This is part of blueprint oslo-multi-publisher

Change-Id: I2eb174cb3000c9cca7d3771a2ab66a1a948f5cd9
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

"}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-03-28 15:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-28 15:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/5/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1343 : SUCCESS

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/6/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1344 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/6/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/1128 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/6/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/987 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/6/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/1311 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/6/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26-rhel6/28 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/6/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1313 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-03-28 15:51:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Just to explain patch 5 - I tried to do what Jason suggested and wanted to post why it doesn't make much sense here. The code does the same thing as patch 6: wraps the methods in exception handlers.

What wasn't mentioned in comments on patch 3 is that both memcache and non-memcache interfaces have to coexist at the same time. This can be done, but is far from nice. Doing this via proper decorators and getting rid of a wrapper class:

- makes testing harder (creating fake cache driver would complicate testing a lot due to import-time loading of memcache and implementations hidden behind wrappers)
- needs crazy implementation that uses wrappers, import-time conditional class creation, abuses MRO and multiple inheritance
- defines method bodies which never get called
- is ~2 times longer than standard class composition
- needs to list the masked methods anyway

In my opinion it just doesn't make sense to complicate code that much. Composition is simple and works. I updated the code to import memcache only the first time the module is loaded and to simplify the wrapper a bit, but I'm against complicating it more."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-03-28 16:21:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

That's cools, I'll let the rest of the community weight in.

I don't really get why we have to support mixed dict and memcache backed clients at runtime though as the only projects using this currently is nova (only ever calling get_client() without any arguments) and keystone_client (only calling it in the middleware init and always passing arguments) so its always either going to be memcached backed or not."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-29 17:58:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I'm not sure I buy the idea behind this

memorycache.Client is supposed to mimic the behaviour of memcache.Client

If there is a bug here, it is that memorycache.Client is raising exceptions in cases where memcache.Client doesn't return an error and, e.g., just returns False

Why then are we wrapping both memcache.Client? We shouldn't be changing the semantics of that API"}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-03-30 02:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-30 02:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/7/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1359 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/7/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/1143 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/7/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/994 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/7/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/1326 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/7/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26-rhel6/37 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25519/7/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1328 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-03-30 02:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Mark The problem here is that whether the problem is with memcache or local Client class, the caller still dies. Neither implementation has 100% test coverage and either one can fail from runtime errors.

I wouldn't expect each call to cache method to be wrapped in an "except Exception:" handler, but that would be required without this patch. Wrapping the clients to return the default "I failed" value if anything goes wrong will at least keep the calling code happy.

For context about why this is needed - I run into an issue where the object saved couldn't be serialised. This did not prevent the object from being created or used - it just broke caching. But because Client threw a TypeError, the whole original operation failed. So instead of a missing cache entry and a slightly longer response time, no instances could be spawned at all. Assuming such errors are common and need to be isolated in this case is just a pragmatic approach.

There are many other cases which can fail due to silly mistakes (from local Client implementation): incr on a non-int entry, set with non-int time, etc. They should never happen. But if they do, I don't want them to break more than the single cache entry.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-31 18:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd prefer you to address the issue of "we need better error handling when dealing with memcache" separately from the issue of "the local memcache.Client impementation throws errors which the normal implementation never throws"

memorycache.Client is intended to be a drop-in replacement for memcache.Client

if we want to add code to Oslo to help with handling errors, I'd prefer it to be separate from memorycache.Client'}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-04-02 12:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Mark Could you explain what did you mean by the last comment, please?

What I assume is:
- memcache.Client is not always returning what the api docs say it should return and we have no control over it
- local Client is not always compliant either and even though we have control over it, we will make mistakes
- therefore we need a protection layer that does the same for both - a "these functions never throw exceptions" guarantee

Are you proposing that this should be moved into some place separate from the memorycache module itself?
Or that local implementation of Client should have those exception handled internally in addition to the global protection?
Or ...?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-02 21:58:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'd like you to address this as two separate things:

1) fix specific places in memorycache.Client where we're throwing exceptions that would never be thrown by memcache.Client

2) improve handling of exceptions thrown by both memcache.Client and memorycache.Client

Not all exceptions are the same - I don't think we should had an exception handler that treats all exceptions equally, so I we should understand the specific exceptions can be raised in (1) and (2)"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-04-03 16:24:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Mark,

As I understand it the issue that triggered this is an (undocumented) exception thrown by memcache.   If I understand you correctly you'd prefer that rather than enforce memcache and memorycache to be consistent via a wrapper class you'd prefer to match the memcache functionality in memorycache (in this case by adding the exception throwing behaviour to memorycache) and then add exception handling in the code wherever the client is used ?

Stan's logic that users of this simple cache module should never have to expect to get an exception (since if the cache action fails they just fail back to some less optimal behaviour) seems reasonable to me, and the implementation of a wrapper class therefore logical.  


It's not really clear to me why the approach your proposing would be significantly better that the already working approach that Stan has proposed, but maybe I'm missing something.  

The absence of a working Memcache implementation is causing us a significant issue in multi-threaded metadata servers so I'm keen to see something that fixes this now, with maybe a better solution to follow that for this to spin for a long time.  Would you consider allowing this to go through of now and we could have a deeper discussion about a rework in Portland (Stan and I will both be there) ?

Thanks,
Phil"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-11 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-11 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-03-27 13:05:43.000000000', 'message': 'Stop propagation of internal errors

Errors happening inside of memorycache client implementation should
not appear as errors in the code calling memorycache methods.
Propagating internal failures can cause the calling code to fail
instead of just acting as if cache lookup resulted in a miss.

Fixes bug 1160883

commit_message:
Stop propagation of internal errors

Errors happening inside of memorycache client implementation should
not appear as errors in the code calling memorycache methods.
Propagating internal failures can cause the calling code to fail
instead of just acting as if cache lookup resulted in a miss.

Fixes bug 1160883

Change-Id: I01c0edfa8c7379829f9d5e0c33dde61484653703

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-22 20:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Still works for me.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-03-22 23:51:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Is there a test that can be made to demonstrate a the two cases of IOError and ValueError?

What I have seen in the wild is ValueError is raised when the client sends poorly formatted chunked-encoding packets, which is not quite the same as the client closing the connection prematurely. Is there another case for ValueError?

And finally, don't we already try to log 499 entries when the client disconnects prematurely?"}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-03-23 05:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Pete, please see the bug and bug comments on how to recreate
the problem. Also use the same code to test the patch.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-03-23 11:40:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

@litong

Do we not want to capture this behavior as a unit test? That is the point of the questions. It would seem prudent to have a unit test that exercises the behaviors we are trying to handle so that we can verify them properly.

The concern raised in this review is that we are catching both ValueError and IOError which won't always match a client disconnecting prematurely."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-03-25 14:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Peter, what other exception can possibly occur when a client disconnect other than the two already get caught? I do really
appreciate some details. The code that in the bug comment
actually demonstrated that behavior and reproduces the
exception. How will this be tested in an unit test case? I do
not have problems to add few unit test cases. Any idea or
pointer will be much appreciated.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-03-25 15:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-25 15:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-04-03 19:31:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please use a try: finally to handle this (maybe a context manager?).  Its not good that you have to remember to call that function in so many places and lends itself to mistakes. Case in point the close_connections was left out on line 993:

self.app.logger.error(
                _('Object servers returned %s mismatched etags'), len(etags))
            return HTTPServerError(request=req)"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-11 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

is not handled, the trace stack fills up the log file. This fix

commit_message:
Fixes the client disconnect trace stack problem.

Currently chunked transfer client disconnect causes unhandled
value error in object server and proxy server. Since the exception
is not handled, the trace stack fills up the log file. This fix
handles the exception and log an error in the log file.

Fixes: bug #667956
Change-Id: I840772f1e97ed084f74c45e1e0801fc0467fbb6c

commit_message:
Adds endpoint v2 to v3 db migration tests

Adds db migration testcases with data for migrations 011, 012,
and 013 which comprise the endpoint v2 to v3 db migration.

Removes test_upgrade_endpoints from test_sql_upgrade as it is covered
by the new db migration testcases

Change-Id: I41660a8ab2051b542888aea9edb9336f16849750

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 15:32:59.000000000', 'message': "Force copy of devstack localrc on each run.

This commit forces the devstack localrc files for both base and
target on each run. Previously the file is only updated if the
localrc file didn't already exist. (Or the user does not have
read permissions) This commit just removes that check so that
the devstack.localrc files are copied on every run.

Change-Id: I474e53ebab943e8b95e8259b6b5a8cc7f63ba4e2
"}, {'created': '2013-03-27 18:09:06.000000000', 'message': "Force copy of devstack localrc on each run.

This commit forces the devstack localrc files for both base and
target on each run. Previously the file is only updated if the
localrc file didn't already exist. (Or the user does not have
read permissions) This commit just adds a localrc variable
that changes this behavior so that the devstack.localrc files
are copied on every run. But, the default behavior remains the
same.

Change-Id: I474e53ebab943e8b95e8259b6b5a8cc7f63ba4e2
"}]
commit_message:
Force copy of devstack localrc on each run.

This commit forces the devstack localrc files for both base and
target on each run. Previously the file is only updated if the
localrc file didn't already exist. (Or the user does not have
read permissions) This commit just adds a localrc variable
that changes this behavior so that the devstack.localrc files
are copied on every run. But, the default behavior remains the
same.

Change-Id: I474e53ebab943e8b95e8259b6b5a8cc7f63ba4e2

commit_message:
Update pool_id in test_update_vip unit test

Fixes: bug #1157300

The unit test for updating a VIP should test that the pool_id can be
updated. This fix will create a pool and a VIP, update the VIP with
the pool_id, then verify the pool_id was updated.

Change-Id: I8d89b1593def2b7b40c631b25dfd8514c4501065

Commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 added a new method to
the compute rpc API.  A test was not added to compute/test_rpcapi.py for
this.  I noticed when I hit a bug in a patch I'm working on that would

The addition to the client side also missed adding the version number

Fix bug 1167356.

Change-Id: I46055a666fe3cf4a923002f11d22c3b6a6d020e2
"}, {'created': '2013-04-10 21:04:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix issues with check_instance_shared_storage.

Commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 added a new method to
the compute rpc API.  A test was not added to compute/test_rpcapi.py for
this.  I noticed when I hit a bug in a patch I'm working on that would
have been caught by this test.

The addition to the client side also missed adding the version number
that was required for this method to be supported.

Since the versioning wasn't set up fully, this patch goes ahead and adds
the instance to the data being sent, as well.  It's more consistent,
even if not used (yet).

Fix bug 1167356.

Change-Id: I46055a666fe3cf4a923002f11d22c3b6a6d020e2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with check_instance_shared_storage.

Commit 52f6981aa35e27c48587ad2320891db8364edd02 added a new method to
the compute rpc API.  A test was not added to compute/test_rpcapi.py for
this.  I noticed when I hit a bug in a patch I'm working on that would
have been caught by this test.

The addition to the client side also missed adding the version number
that was required for this method to be supported.

Since the versioning wasn't set up fully, this patch goes ahead and adds
the instance to the data being sent, as well.  It's more consistent,
even if not used (yet).

Fix bug 1167356.

Change-Id: I46055a666fe3cf4a923002f11d22c3b6a6d020e2

subject: Imported Translations from Transifex
messages:
[{'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-04-11 00:27:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Not your average Translations import: 48,608 lines removed

AFAIK this is related to a fix in the translations imports that didn't delete old translations for files that don't exist anymore."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2013-04-11 00:39:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The infra team hasn't made any recent changes to the translation jobs that would result in this behaviour. However, I think this change is safe. It is merely cleaning up commented out translations which are not used.

Now how this may have happened:
1. Babel updated (pypi still shows ancient babel so I don't think this is the case).
2. Someone on the transifex side of things updated the .po files there so when we merged them in this was the result.
3. A minor change to the translation proposal script did this (I think this didn't happen either).

Option 2 seems the most plausible. If we want to be super careful we can try reaching out to our translators."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-11 00:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-04-11 04:56:03.000000000', 'message': 'Prevents a portinfo deletion in vm migration with NEC plugin.

Fixes: Bug 1160193

This patch prevents a portinfo deletion at the end of the migration sequence

Change-Id: I96932587b9d660aa01f8fcae0b0426c849d6c483
'}]
commit_message:
Prevents a portinfo deletion in vm migration with NEC plugin.

Fixes: Bug 1160193

This patch prevents a portinfo deletion at the end of the migration sequence
by ignoring port_removed message from the source host.

Change-Id: I96932587b9d660aa01f8fcae0b0426c849d6c483

commit_message:
Fix backup manager formatting error.

ID was being printed as %d instead of %s, causing tests to fail. This
error was previously undetected.
In addition, NetApp tests are failing due to a bug in the suds
package, which is no longer actively maintained. This patch adds skips
to the problematic tests, which should be removed once the issue is
resolved.

Change-Id: I5645909f59aa2ea3dc536ed4707ea75754307050
Fixes: bug 1166600
(cherry picked from commit 23bd028ce39bebf0f5d2403df328ad55e6eb007e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-08 09:25:33.000000000', 'message': "Clean up attach/detach tests.

The code tested by test_preattach_status_volume was moved, and the
test no longer tested anything relevant (i.e., instead of checking
that the volume is 'attached', the test was changed to test for
'available' since the attach code was moved). This patch, therefore,
deletes that test.

Further, test_run_attach_detach_volume called database functions for
attaching and detaching. This patch changes those calls to call
higher-level functions which in turn call the database functions. This
gives better code coverage and gives the tests more meaning.

Change-Id: If688fe6a14940148b5792256c8507803e8cde901
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up attach/detach tests.

The code tested by test_preattach_status_volume was moved, and the
test no longer tested anything relevant (i.e., instead of checking
that the volume is 'attached', the test was changed to test for
'available' since the attach code was moved). This patch, therefore,
deletes that test.

Further, test_run_attach_detach_volume called database functions for
attaching and detaching. This patch changes those calls to call
higher-level functions which in turn call the database functions. This
gives better code coverage and gives the tests more meaning.

Change-Id: If688fe6a14940148b5792256c8507803e8cde901

commit_message:
Set network defaults.

Updates nova::network so that it uses some default values
(that match nova).

Change-Id: If199149c957debd0566bfa07fda31320c32fddbd

Allow to use of rabbit_hosts

Allow to use rabbit_hosts if this one is not provided
rabbit_host and rabbit_port are used instead.

commit_message:
Re-enable detach volume from unrescued VM

Fix syntax around calling wait_for_volume_status. If don't include
parameters on the same line, the function doesn't get evaluated.

Fix bug 1158942

Change-Id: I3ad3b8ee07f79bc440d9b26489777510340af2f9

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-04-02 06:15:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Do not merge

Why did you combine so many distinct changes into one?  Some of this can go right in but I have some issues with other bits.  And I'm too tired to do it all tonight so it'll have to wait.

re rpms-rhel6: read up on the #DISTRO marker in get_packages().  I don't like the idea of a version number in the path, and the whole thing may not be necessary at all.  We already have enough problems with people maintaining 3 sets.

I'm going to have to be sold on the idea of adding the post-prereq bit."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-04-02 09:04:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

thanks for looking

> Why did you combine so many distinct changes into one?

Another reviewer requested I make the change to enable rhel6 support atomic, hence I compressed the required changes for this review.  Previously I had them split out per [1] which you may prefer.  I'm happy to do either

> re rpms-rhel6: read up on the #DISTRO marker in get_packages(). I don't like the idea of a version number in the path

I did see that, but my thinking was that rhel6 was a very static target and hence deserved to be called out separately to avoid turning the fedora path into a branching mess over time.

> I'm going to have to be sold on the idea of adding the post-prereq bit.

My preference is to source specific files for distro specific workarounds rather than roll them into what should be a generic driver script.  I feel like the things in the rhel6 setup file aren't really worth working around in any generic fashion.

[1] https://github.com/ianw/devstack/commits/rhel64-v2"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-04-02 11:00:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I also want to step back a minute and figure out *why* we're talking about adding RHEL6 as a devstack target.

Devstack is a development tool, not a generic installer. Do you believe upstream development is going to be happening on RHEL6?"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-04-02 21:31:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The intent is to satisfy requests from people who have rhel as their basic standard environment for an easy path to using top-of-tree upstream for both testing and development.

For the most part the change is a specialization of the existing Fedora path; although I did create a separate rpm-list to avoid the existing one becoming too tangled up. 

I wanted to get the review out for comments early; internally I'm working on some continuous-integration testing of devstack/rhel so that we detect ongoing issues."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-04-03 02:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-03 02:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-03-26 23:15:36.000000000', 'message': 'Create separate RPM lists for RHEL6

Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes here
to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that are too
old or conflict

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
'}, {'created': '2013-03-27 04:08:45.000000000', 'message': 'Create separate RPM lists for RHEL6

Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes here
to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that are too
old or conflict

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
'}, {'created': '2013-04-01 22:52:32.000000000', 'message': 'Create separate RPM lists for RHEL6

Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes here
to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that are too
old or conflict

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
'}, {'created': '2013-04-02 03:14:29.000000000', 'message': "RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for
   the very minimal usage by lesscss.

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
"}, {'created': '2013-04-02 03:32:14.000000000', 'message': "RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for
   the very minimal usage by lesscss.

 - By default RHEL6 qpidd ships with authentication on, which causes
   Kerberos errors; override this

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
"}, {'created': '2013-04-03 02:07:40.000000000', 'message': "RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for

 - By default RHEL6 qpidd ships with authentication on, which causes
   Kerberos errors; override this

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5
"}, {'created': '2013-04-03 22:00:37.000000000', 'message': "RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for
   the very minimal usage by lesscss.

commit_message:
RHEL6 core support

 - Allow RHEL6 as a valid target for installation

 - Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora

 - Add some post-prereq actions:
  * pre-install dbus to avoid the service not having ever been started
  * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
  * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
    of local versions
  * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

 - Split out the RHEL6 rpms into a separate list.  Various changes
   here to the base Fedora versions to not specify RHEL6 packages that
   are too old or conflict

 - The RHEL6 version of pip doesn't have support for mirrors, so skip
   asking for them.

 - Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6,
   or you get authentication errors with libvirt

 - RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way
   is to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for
   the very minimal usage by lesscss.

 - By default RHEL6 qpidd ships with authentication on, which causes
   Kerberos errors; override this

Change-Id: I89aa507ae15df49383a32a1c4b4767acbf30bdf5

commit_message:
Adds create volume from image test

This is implemented by reusing the existing code written
for volume_create_get_delete; that function has been renamed
and has support for an the parameter 'image_ref'. The pre-existing
volume_create_get_delete as also the new volume_from_image call
the now renamed old function.

Change-Id: I08e69560e68b8f9a47d96d4446c35a670e17d1a9
Implements: blueprint add-volume-creation-from-image

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-08 23:51:54.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize some of compute/manager's periodic tasks' DB queries

Most of these tasks do not need to fetch instances with a full complement of
metadata items. Make them say "no thanks" to the DB API to reduce the amount of
work that needs to be done. Note some refactoring was done in the
_get_instance_nw_info() method to pull this information if it ended up being
necessary. The cases where this would happen are error-cleanup scenarios, and thus
taking the extra hit in that case is an overall win for not having to do it all
the time.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ic7d6290c0b7edf84cbf8bdc64e29f206619f97e5

_get_instance_nw_info() method to pull this information if it ended up being
necessary. The cases where this would happen are error-cleanup scenarios, and thus
taking the extra hit in that case is an overall win for not having to do it all

commit_message:
Optimize some of compute/manager's periodic tasks' DB queries

Most of these tasks do not need to fetch instances with a full
complement of metadata items. Make them say "no thanks" to the DB API
to reduce the amount of work that needs to be done. Note some
refactoring was done in the _get_instance_nw_info() method to pull
this information if it ended up being necessary. The cases where this
would happen are error-cleanup scenarios, and thus taking the extra
hit in that case is an overall win for not having to do it all the
time.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ic7d6290c0b7edf84cbf8bdc64e29f206619f97e5

[{'created': '2013-04-01 18:46:01.000000000', 'message': 'glance-manage should not require glance-registry.conf

In v2 the glance-registry service is no longer needed.  Thus
it is possible that a setup would not include a configuration
file for it at all.  Therefore glance-manage should not look
to that file for its database configuration information.  This
change directs glance-manage to the glance-api.conf file.

Fixes bug: 1046576

Change-Id: Ida68a5c03eb3d188b2b997296cd45730b968ef12
'}, {'created': '2013-04-03 20:28:02.000000000', 'message': 'glance-manage should not require glance-registry.conf

In v2 the glance-registry service is no longer needed.  Thus
it is possible that a setup would not include a configuration
file for it at all.  Further it is possible that glance-api and
glance-registry be run on different machines such that neither
configuration file is available to the other.  Therefore glance-manage
should be able to pull the information out of either configuration
file provided that the overriding command line options:
--sql_connection or --config-file are not used.  This patch makes
it so glance-manage will first look in the glance-registry.conf file
for db information (as this is the legacy behavior) and then in
the glance-api.conf file if that file does not exist.

Fixes bug: 1046576
Change-Id: Ida68a5c03eb3d188b2b997296cd45730b968ef12
'}]
commit_message:
glance-manage should not require glance-registry.conf

In v2 the glance-registry service is no longer needed.  Thus
it is possible that a setup would not include a configuration
file for it at all.  Further it is possible that glance-api and
glance-registry be run on different machines such that neither
configuration file is available to the other.  Therefore glance-manage
should be able to pull the information out of either configuration
file provided that the overriding command line options:
--sql_connection or --config-file are not used.  This patch makes
it so glance-manage will first look in the glance-registry.conf file
for db information (as this is the legacy behavior) and then in
the glance-api.conf file if that file does not exist.

Fixes bug: 1046576
Change-Id: Ida68a5c03eb3d188b2b997296cd45730b968ef12

commit_message:
Don't hide stacktraces for unexpected errors in rescue

Prevent rescue commands from hiding stacktraces for unexpected errors.
Before this the wrap_errors function would catch unexpected errors and
hide them, with a generic HTTPInternalServerError without any
stacktrace.

Change-Id: I80e0ae8257117a3e5a4c946b38870aad0e58cc12

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary check for writable output dir.

os-config-applier is useful by non-root users who have access to
write the files they need to in sub-directories under the main output
directory.

Change-Id: I52af0bd076f3fef99ea09a3074f0b0d5b7e9afca

commit_message:
Add dnspython as a requirement.

This is needed for the dynamic dns driver I have for nova. I've
selected the version number based on what pip is currently
installing, and therefore what I have tested.

commit_message:
Optimize some of the periodic task database queries in n-cpu

There are a few trivial periodic tasks that can benefit from telling
the DB API (via conductor) not to fetch metadata items. This patch
makes those changes

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: I8e2730d3ed74bd7e0a0217647316c1cf492f22f3

subject: Change DB API instance functions for selective metadata fetching

'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-04-10 03:31:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Your commit message and the actual change seem disconnected.

Also the change seems to be exporting SQL data model over the wire, which is generally a poor design for API efficiency ... but that may be baked into the conductor design and so something we need to rework at a larger scale."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-04-10 07:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

To lifeless:  If you're referring to the fact that you're now exposing potential columns to join via the API.... these don't necessarily need to map to column names in the model in the future.  Dan had made a comment on IRC about not really liking 'columns_to_join' for this reason, I think.  I tend to agree that maybe a better variable name should be picked that doesn't include the word "column".  Whatever it is named, we do really need a way to say "join/include <x>" so that we can query the DB efficiently.  <x> can be arbitrary names that the DB API maps to whatever it needs to, however.  We definitely don't want these to *have* to match the models, because of the plans for versioned objects and untying of nova <-> model that Dan, myself, and probably others have been thinking about.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-04-10 13:44:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Indeed, I don't like anything outside the db api knowing about columns or DB schema in general, but today they do. Going forward, I think we can do better, but for now, adding columns_to_join here matches other examples already in the codebase."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Change DB API instance functions for selective metadata fetching

This makes the DB API for instance_get_all() variants able to take a
columns_to_join parameter like the base instance_get_all() function,
which provides control over whether we go to the trouble of pulling
the metadata out of the database before we return the instances.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: Ie7c012e2e12bb91ef4294cdc90d828af255b67c5

commit_message:
Cache metadata in /var/cache instead of /tmp

/tmp is unsafe if a user were to somehow be able to create the file
before it was cached there they can issue commands to cfn-init that
would likely elevate their permissions.

Fixes bug #1164756

Change-Id: I54e1e1be178274cb0a2b50f54e859e004e1f1c78

commit_message:
Use tempfile.mkdtemp to avoid tempfile race

Malicious users could predict these tempfile names and overwrite root
owned files using a symlink attack.

Also fixes a bug in order of operations which caused tar to fail if
the destination directory did not exist yet.

Fixes bug #1166323

Change-Id: Ib4040eed27aa7e1e4d2bf53df6cae8e2b6c95f50

This breaks backward compatibility. How do we want to deal with this?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-10 14:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Mathieu: Yes. It does break compat...

I suppose at this point I value consistency with other modules (puppet-nova) over this.

What if I make an old cinder:base class that inherits the new cinder class? That would fix compat no?'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-04-10 18:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Unfortunately inheritance does not work that way in Puppet. You cannot inherit parameters from the parent class.

We would have to create a cinder::base class with all original parameters and pass them around to the cinder class. We could throw a warning informing the user about the deprecation of cinder::base.

If we want to preserve backward compatibility, this is my suggestion on the way to go.'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-04-10 18:46:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Renames cinder::base to cinder.

This makes things consistent with other puppet openstack modules
(Nova in particular).

For backwards compat we still have a cinder::base module which
uses init.pp but prints out a warning message.

Change-Id: Ie101ae192b7ff08825809aff975f6cc6e655e6b3

commit_message:
Bug in SLO with multipart-manifest=get content type.

In trying to override the content-type for the convenience
call I broke COPYs and POSTs for SLO. yaaa...

Change-Id: Ifbcda6d2dd0ee43e43d62e58a90301e7afd05e27

Great addition. I have one problem - when running the test there is no output to the console. One only knows if the tests have passed or failed.
I think that there was a similar issue with nova and this was resolved. Any chance of sorting this out before we approve this.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The change should wait until Havana opens.  I think there are several pieces found in the Nova change that are missing from this version.  tox integration  stands out the most.  Also, I tried invoking using the command line with testr and with ./run_tests.sh.  There is no output until the whole test suite has run.  I don't think this is very developer friendly especially if a test hangs.  

This should be a relatively self contained change that might be candidate for back porting once a version lands in the Havana branch."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

cp: cannot stat `.testrepository/-1': No such file or directory"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Bump,It would be awesome if we could get this patch working :)'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'll look into why jenkins is failing."}, {'account_id': 6369, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 6369, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Gary:  Clark has pointed out to me what nova has done to allow intermediate test output.  I'm working to add that to this change now."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Incremental output going away is a known and expected thing at the moment, and is related to the way that the parallel testing reports back (interleaved results anyone?) There is a new version of python-subunut and testr on their way which will address this concern.

In the mean time, vishy made a filter script that can be added to run_tests.sh (for those who use it) that will give incremental output at the moment - even though there care some cases where it might get confused.

As a final followup - the log messages that are being shown there I _believe_ are indications that there is something weird with log initialization in general that got fixed recently in nova by changing how logging init works. The fakelogger fixture in the test case should pick those up appropriately once base logging is done properly.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 21:38:14.000000000', 'message': 'Parallelize quantum unit testing:

This change switches run_tests.sh to use testr
in parallel mode, instead of nosetests, in order
to enable unit tests to run in parallel.

By default, the number of parallel test processes
is set to the number of cores on the test machine.

A similar change was recently merged to nova:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15078/

Some tests required updating to remove inter-testcase
dependencies.

bug #1099694

Change-Id: Idfb923d424342a07dcba88d70b971683f549f763

commit_message:
Parallelize quantum unit testing:

This change switches run_tests.sh to use testr
in parallel mode, instead of nosetests, in order
to enable unit tests to run in parallel.

By default, the number of parallel test processes
is set to the number of cores on the test machine.

A similar change was recently merged to nova:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15078/

Some tests required updating to remove inter-testcase
dependencies.

bug #1099694

Change-Id: Idfb923d424342a07dcba88d70b971683f549f763

commit_message:
Replace metadata joins with another query

Right now, we always join metadata and system_metadata when we query for
instances. This inflates the number of rows returned by a factor of ten
at a minimum, and over 30 in some situations. This patch avoids the
direct join of these tables in favor of a "manual join" which performs
additional queries to fill the needed data. Latency may be increased,
but with the gain of a potentially significant amount of reduction in
data transfer.

This also provides the ability for the queries which utilize it to
selectively decide whether either or both of these additional fills are
performed, paving the way for future high-level optimizations.

Related to bug 1164737

Change-Id: I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9

that have one.

[{'created': '2013-04-07 22:26:31.000000000', 'message': 'set timeout for paramiko ssh connection

set powervm connection timeout to 60 seconds
to eliminate crashing if ssh server is slow in
responding.

Change-Id: Ic7f4d092de73e73c6edb909713bf3a2347a50334
'}]
commit_message:
set timeout for paramiko ssh connection

set powervm connection timeout to 60 seconds
to eliminate crashing if ssh server is slow in
responding.

Change-Id: Ic7f4d092de73e73c6edb909713bf3a2347a50334

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-04-03 13:05:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I -1 because this patch is only copying the current bm_nodes.prov_mac_address values to the bm_interfaces table without changing the behavior of adding new nodes (they'll still get a prov_mac_address).

IMHO, this patch should either:
- drop the prov_mac_address column entirely (and thus incorporate the following patch for virtual_power_driver)

or it should:
- remove the unique constraint on prov_mac_address
- set all current prov_mac_address values to NULL
- and change the API so that this field is left NULL for new nodes (and then it can be dropped in a subsequent migration).

I also think the migration needs to handle duplicated addresses -- I believe it is currently possible for deployers to specify the same MAC both as prov_mac_address and in bm_interfaces."}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-04-04 10:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-04-04 10:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Now this patch can handle duplicated addresses.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-02 03:26:12.000000000', 'message': "baremetal: Integrate provisioning and non-provisioning interfaces

Originally, baremetal pxe/tilera driver managed two types of network
interfaces in two tables; provisioning interfaces in bm_nodes table
and non-provisioning (normal) interfaces in bm_interfaces table.
But, now actually both types are handled in the same way and there is
no difference between them except for which table they are in.

This patch moves the boot interfaces to bm_interfaces. However it
does not drop prov_mac_address in bm_nodes since VirtualPowerManager
still uses it to identify a target in a list of VMs returned by the
VM's host.

Change-Id: I5ce940e7127aa3b29ba7802612938dc5dbc3152f
"}, {'created': '2013-04-02 04:47:38.000000000', 'message': "baremetal: Integrate provisioning and non-provisioning interfaces

commit_message:
baremetal: Integrate provisioning and non-provisioning interfaces

Originally, baremetal pxe/tilera driver managed two types of network
interfaces in two tables; provisioning interfaces in bm_nodes table
and non-provisioning (normal) interfaces in bm_interfaces table.
But, now actually both types are handled in the same way and there is
no difference between them except for which table they are in.

This patch moves the provisioning interfaces to bm_interfaces. However
it does not drop prov_mac_address in bm_nodes since VirtualPowerManager
still uses it to identify a target in a list of VMs returned by the
VM's host.

Change-Id: I5ce940e7127aa3b29ba7802612938dc5dbc3152f

commit_message:
Fix error message in pre_live_migration.

We are using locals() to reference a variable which doesn't exist
in this error message. Also rename the instance variable while I
am here to be more consistent with other uses.

Resolves bug 1164072.

Change-Id: I96f5e2a81ac2e97181c3e87df83e19b381f4bcd2

commit_message:
Adding a new optional variable called trans_id_suffix

The trans_id_suffix (default is empty) would be appended to the swift transaction
id allowing one to easily figure out from which cluster that X-Trans-Id
belongs to. This is very useful when one is managing more than one swift
cluster. Also updated sample and manpage to reflect the changes.

Change-Id: Icdf63643e9c1bde36a9ef5e3f41ee9fb20e55f5d

commit_message:
Fixes private functions private

Fixed functions below to private APIs.

raise_if_duplicate_entry_error()
raise_if_deadlock_error()
wrap_db_error()
synchronous_switch_listener()
add_regexp_listener()
greenthread_yield()
ping_listener()
is_db_connection_error()
patch_mysqldb_with_stacktrace_comments()

Fixes bug #1119709

Change-Id: I61f700cdbae0126a8b89f6895e4332d695191dd0

commit_message:
Improved mongodb's storage queries and indexes

The patch reduces the number of indexes needed and changes how data is
stored.

Major changes:
    * Messages expire now contains claim's expire for messages whos
    expiration time is less than claims.
    * New messages now contain a fake claim object that allows the
    driver for querying using that field even when the message hasn't
    been claimed. (see `active`)

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

Change-Id: Ia932d15fb3a3e0e7c50d667fae330cb031e34a8a

The Block Storage Admin Guide PDF in the HP 3PAR Fibre Channel
and iSCSI driver section could add a few spaces to improve readability
in the Supported Operations section. This fixes the following few lines:

provisioning - Defaults to thin provisioning, the valid values are thinand full.
<need to add a space character after thin and before and>

persona - Defaults to the 1  Genericpersona.
<need to add a space between Generic and persona>

Change-Id: I7278ea2c4ba43003ccce4fcf43bc233b3b2760c3

'}]
commit_message:
3PAR Block Storage Driver space character issues

The Block Storage Admin Guide PDF in the HP 3PAR Fibre Channel
and iSCSI driver section could add a few spaces to improve readability
in the Supported Operations section. This fixes the following few lines:

provisioning - Defaults to thin provisioning, the valid values are thinand full.
<need to add a space character after thin and before and>

persona - Defaults to the 1  Genericpersona.
<need to add a space between Generic and persona>

Change-Id: I7278ea2c4ba43003ccce4fcf43bc233b3b2760c3
Fixes: bug 1167468

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 00:03:22.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify volume related exception message

Before the message was "status must be available," which could either mean
nova couldn't fetch the status or the status was not set to 'available'. As
this message means the latter, make it more explicit by putting available in
quotes.

Change-Id: I1b167073463c781569919926fa9b8960f4fecf59
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify volume related exception message

Before the message was "status must be available," which could either mean
nova couldn't fetch the status or the status was not set to 'available'. As
this message means the latter, make it more explicit by putting available in
quotes.

Change-Id: I1b167073463c781569919926fa9b8960f4fecf59

commit_message:
Simplify random host choice.

The random Python module provides a handy funcion for choosing a random
element from a sequence.  Use that instead of a more manual method of
accomplishing the same thing.

Change-Id: I1908bd5e79b6c21d0dcf7e540143e9b8de478d24

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-05 17:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/26241/1/check/gate-noop/964 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-05 18:25:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks great - good, clean work. I'd like John or Mike to take a look also."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-04-09 05:36:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Have some corrections on the response codes. Also Anne, wondering if directly under API Operation is where extensions should go. We'll probably document more later, but they're optionally enabled unlike everything else already in API operations. Just wondering if it should be API Operations -> Extensions -> Backups...or maybe that's too specific? Thanks Stephen!"}, {'account_id': 6153, 'date': '2013-04-09 08:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-09 08:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/26241/2/check/gate-noop/1017 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6153, 'date': '2013-04-09 08:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fixed response codes.

No problem moving it to another section if you wish, just let me know where.'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-04-10 05:06:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Stephen. The rest looks good...trying to find out where the contribs should be located or if we're fine with them being with the main api operations."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-10 14:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I consider these to be "specs" so for this audience, they would probably want to know that backups is an extension (so if they go spelunking in the code they'll figure it out sooner). API users probably don't really care, but for this document, describing the API quite descriptively is best. My vote would be for putting it into API > Extensions > Backups.'}, {'account_id': 6153, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6153, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Allow to use of rabbit_hosts

Allow to use rabbit_hosts if this one is not provided
rabbit_host and rabbit_port are used instead.

commit_message:
Fix backup manager formatting error.

ID was being printed as %d instead of %s, causing tests to fail. This
error was previously undetected.
In addition, NetApp tests are failing due to a bug in the suds
package, which is no longer actively maintained. This patch adds skips
to the problematic tests, which should be removed once the issue is
resolved.

Change-Id: I5645909f59aa2ea3dc536ed4707ea75754307050
Fixes: bug 1166600

commit_message:
Remove an invalid trove classifier.

* setup.py(setuptools.setup): Remove "Intended Audience :: BigDate"
since it's not in pypi's list of valid trove classifiers and
prevents successful upload of the package when present.

Change-Id: Iee487d1737a12158bb181d21ae841d07e0820e10

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-29 11:01:08.000000000', 'message': 'The parameter of some APIs are not full list.

In current API doc, the parameter is not full list for bellow API:
1.POST v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments,
  in current document, there are 2 parameter in Parameter part:
  "tenant-id" and "server id". But it should include
  "volumeAttachment", "volumeId","device"
2.POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks Create a network,
  only list tenant_id in Parameter part
3. No Request Sample in POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks.

Fix bug 1158616

Change-Id: I66f0e29d186ea8f1bdf6a23d3cc9c0ca72db974e
'}]
commit_message:
The parameter of some APIs are not full list.

In current API doc, the parameter is not full list for bellow API:
1.POST v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments,
  in current document, there are 2 parameter in Parameter part:
  "tenant-id" and "server id". But it should include
  "volumeAttachment", "volumeId","device"
2.POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks Create a network,
  only list tenant_id in Parameter part
3. No Request Sample in POST v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks.

Fix bug 1158616

Change-Id: I66f0e29d186ea8f1bdf6a23d3cc9c0ca72db974e

Why just copy the filters and not the filter scheduler itself?

Additionally I do not see the filter_scheduler in cinder, as you have described in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-12-07 19:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Joe, filter scheduler depends on a number of things: filter, weight, host_manager.  What I'm trying to do is to move as much as possible project independent code into oslo. Host_manager's implementation for now, is project dependent, so it'll take some effect to do better abstraction before I can just 'copy' filter scheduler and its dependency to oslo. 

"Additionally I do not see the filter_scheduler in cinder, as you have described in the commit message."  That's right, the idea of getting filter scheduler into oslo came up in the review process of implement cinder filter scheduler (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14132/). So it's kinda of chicken and egg...'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-12-10 07:06:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This will help cut down on code duplication between Nova and Cinder.  We'll have more work to do to continue cutting down on duplication in the scheduler, but this is a good start.  The submitter is willing to help get this code from Oslo to be used in both Cinder and Nova."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-12-18 00:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-12-20 11:45:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Do not merge

(9 inline comments)

Ok, I do like this work - well done

However, I'm very concerned about Nova adopting this. If Nova doesn't adopt this soon we end up with similar but diverged code in Nova and Oslo. This isn't a better situation than having similar but diverged code in Nova and Cinder, except the divergence is Oslo's problem instead of Cinder's problem :-)

Before merging this into Oslo, I want us to actually be ready to have Nova adopt this

The big issues for Nova will be the switch to entry points and the instance_properties/instance_type things

So, please prepare the patch to have Nova use this and propose it as a WIP review against Nova and add me as a reviewer. When that patch is in good shape, I'll remove the -2 from here

In Ib6b2d11ca42abaa64c40986d72233e7048e504a0 you can see how Russell voluntarily did something similar - he did not want his patch merged into Oslo until he was sure it worked in Nova

I've left a bunch of inline comments too, most of which you ignore except please go back to Nova's original logic for capability scopes and extra specs matching. Also, move the unit test code into tests/unit/scheduler

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-12-21 11:10:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (5 inline comments)

Mark, thanks for the suggestion.  I'll cook Nova patch."}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-12-22 03:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-22 03:17:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

commit_message:
Add common filter/filter handler for filter scheduler

Filter scheduler is being used for more than one core projects (Nova
and Cinder as of writing), the implementation shared a lot of common
code.  This patch moves base filter/filter handler class as well as
common filter implementation for filter scheduler into oslo to reduce
possible porting.

implement bp: common-filters

Change-Id: If0b1dee79c410c98e152230b55c1ec5dbcdef27c

This patch changes the MongoDB driver so that it will use
MongoReplicaSetClient instead of MongoClient when a
replicaSet is specified in the connection URI. Testing
revealed that this is necessary for readPreference to be
respected.

Change-Id: I3c1a2a166c5dd2c857cd52a2d1766437a9e4a940
'}]
commit_message:
fix: Enable reading from secondaries in the MongoDB driver.

This patch changes the MongoDB driver so that it will use
MongoReplicaSetClient instead of MongoClient when a
replicaSet is specified in the connection URI. Testing
revealed that this is necessary for readPreference to be
respected.

Change-Id: I3c1a2a166c5dd2c857cd52a2d1766437a9e4a940

commit_message:
Require cinder package before running sync.

Updates the cinder::api module so that we install the Cinder
package before running the 'cinder-manage db sync' command.

This fixes issues where the db sync can fail (because
the binary and user are missing, etc.)

Change-Id: Ida1da688d08a673ca8673bea263fb0925fbbcc49

commit_message:
Drop ringbuilder.sh from swift module.

We don't use this file anywhere and it may confuse people.
Lets just remove it.

Change-Id: If43ea0ba616c507d7888e3f4b43edf7e2325948a

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-18 15:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I see a bunch of issues here assuming this test is based on https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/openstack-identity-api/src/markdown/identity-api-v3.md

The create api returns 201 so there is no need to wait for the endpoint to appear. If it is not there upon return of the 201, that is a bug. 

The methods should be testing for the proper status but some do not or look for the wrong one (create). 

I don't think the wait_ method in the clients is needed, but if it were needed that method should be using a loop with sleep as we do in other such cases. The current code would blow out the stack if there actually was a delay."}, {'account_id': 6683, 'date': '2013-02-18 18:04:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Few issues mentioned in the inline comments."}, {'account_id': 2238, 'date': '2013-02-20 09:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2238, 'date': '2013-02-20 10:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (5 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-03-05 19:45:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think we need to make the split between the v3 and v2 testing and clients more explicit. See my comments on Harika's commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22317/ on what I mean. I think it would be best if we split up the v2 and v3 testing in separate directories similar to what I did for the glance v1 and v2 tests.

The way you added the clients and tests in this commit make it somewhat difficult to differentiate between v2 and v3 tests."}, {'account_id': 1795, 'date': '2013-03-06 00:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Test cases for Endpoints V3 API

Adds a test script "test_endpoints.py" so as to test CREATE, DELETE,
LIST, UPDATE API actions. endpoints_client.py is added with all the required
methods. Implementation done in JSON and XML interfaces.

Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-endpoints-api-test

Change-Id: Icd47728d161d440440f6b4f103a55125da8bbf29

commit_message:
raise the first exception in flavors and security_group test

The exceptions raised in the finally block hides the exceptions raised
in the try block.

For example if a resource creation fails you would see the exception from the
resource deletion.

This change replaces the finally usage by addCleanup methods.

test_security_group_rules_create_delete removed because of a duplication.

Change-Id: Id69a3b7edd0933f4d5967bd8b84fb16a2095ab0a

This commit removes the smoke.py file and reworks the classes in
test.py to be a bit simpler. Previously, DefaultClientTest
was only really needed by smoke.py for the smoke tests. (the only
place where python clients were used) However, it remained a separate

"}, {'created': '2013-04-09 19:26:33.000000000', 'message': "Remove smoke.py and clean up base test classes

This commit removes the smoke.py file and reworks the classes in
test.py to be a bit simpler. Previously, DefaultClientTest
was only really needed by smoke.py for the smoke tests. (the only
place where python clients were used) However, it remained a separate

commit_message:
Remove smoke.py and clean up base test classes

This commit removes the smoke.py file and reworks the classes in
test.py to be a bit simpler. Previously, DefaultClientTest
was only really needed by smoke.py for the smoke tests. (the only
place where python clients were used) However, it remained a separate
class because of the status_timeout() method. This breaks out that
method and removes the class so that it is more obvious that the
smoke tests are using tempest.manager for it's clients.

Change-Id: Ib4333483c5734d14cac6376837ca770e96bd050e

Addresses xml issues for quota unit tests

Moved check for xmlns to avoid saving to db
