[{'created': '2013-04-10 13:42:20.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude tests when installing python-quantumclient

Dont include the tests directory when installing
ceilometer as they might conflict with other
poorly installed packages on the users systems.

LP: #1165059

Change-Id: I7c83c9ba30680391f24c8a900b3bfc3306919898
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude tests when installing python-quantumclient

Dont include the tests directory when installing
ceilometer as they might conflict with other
poorly installed packages on the users systems.

LP: #1165059

Change-Id: I7c83c9ba30680391f24c8a900b3bfc3306919898
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix for configuring non-default auth plugins properly

Make sure we pick up CONF.auth.methods from configuration
files. Added a test case to make sure the we don't regress

Fixes LP# 1157515

Change-Id: I70290c37b2a5378b5247a14e3bfa20d50bf8fe74

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Sorry for the patch at this moment too.

> You mention "Some version of NEC PFC" ... which versions, though? Are these versions commonly used by people? How big a problem is it for folsom to not support those versions?

The version affected by this bug is PFC V3. V3 and V4 of PFC are commonly used
(V5 is released recently). V3 is the only version in countries except Japan.
As a result Quantum Folsom combined with PFC cannot be used outside Japan.
Though we can apply a private patch, I hope it is merged.

> While conceptually simple, the details in this patch are somewhat complex and risky looking. At least the code is on master, though.

I wrote a little simpler one in the inline comment. I think this is minimum.

Finally, I apologize the patch at this moment and understand your concern if it is not accepted.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

stable/folsom is frozen for 2012.2.4, so this would be an exception to the freeze. See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-April/007273.html


While conceptually simple, the details in this patch are somewhat complex and risky looking. At least the code is on master, though.


You mention "Some version of NEC PFC" ... which versions, though? Are these versions commonly used by people? How big a problem is it for folsom to not support those versions?


Again, marking as -2 for now but I could be persuaded to change to +2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:48:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
plugin/nec: Ensure ID on PFC is up to 31 chars

Some version of NEC ProgrammableFlow OpenFlow controller, one of
the OpenFlow controllers (OFCs), accepts the string up to 31 chars
as a network ID. NEC plugin now uses Quantum UUID as ID on OFC,
so this leads to failure on network creation. This commit changes
the plugin to generate a 31-char ID on OFC to keep its uniqueness.
The same thing can be said to port ID.

Similarly, the description field must be a string up to 127 chars
and consist of [A-Za-z0-9_] characters. This change also fixes it.

Bug #1166077

Change-Id: I0a879f5158a6ac0ce332e3698d42dd38d4283a60

commit_message:
Migrate overridable environment variables to DIB_ namespace.

Anywhere we have an environment variable that can be overridden at
build time, is now migrated to have DIB_ in front of its name. This
will allow future work to scrub the build environment clean of any
variables that do not belong in the build.

Change-Id: I62f7f7a781c79672a7a74277651579fe2e2c0cb9

'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:39:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

Much better thanks.

There are two sources of confusion within it; firstly its not clear whether DIB_ means 'user settable' or 'something whitelisted for passing into the chroot'.

And these are not the same - consider ARCH which isn't meant to be user set (they should use -a).

Secondly, there are places in the patch that name things DIB_ when they are local variables.

So, I'd like to see a little more clarity in this, lets separate the concerns out clearly.

Something like the following:
* DIB_ is a whitelist we use for avoiding accidental pollution of the build environment.
* non-exported variables are never DIB_ prefixed (so if you see DIB_ you can assume it is used inside the build code)
* Some sort of prose around DIB_ARCH - or maybe we should special case it [or do my long threatened change to make -a go away]."}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2013-04-10 11:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Migrate overridable environment variables to DIB_ namespace.

Anywhere we have an environment variable that can be overridden at
build time, is now migrated to have DIB_ in front of its name. This
will allow future work to scrub the build environment clean of any
variables that do not belong in the build.

Change-Id: I62f7f7a781c79672a7a74277651579fe2e2c0cb9

commit_message:
plugin/nec: Drop description field from PFC create_tenant

Some version of PFC, one of OpenFlow controllers supported in NEC
plugin, does not accept "description" field in create_tenant().

Removes update_tenant() in pfc.py since it is not used anywhere.

Fixes bug #1166076

Change-Id: I817bb67465ff47df43ad2ea866e40c4413f29cbb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 10:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e
'}, {'created': '2013-04-10 10:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

commit_message:
Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e

commit_message:
Fix Makefile for XenServer builds

The provided Makefile failed to build the agent rpm for XenServer, using
the 6.1 ddk:
- version info was using only python instead of python2.6
- Failed to retrieve version info - bad paths
- Non unattended yum instruction - added -qy
- unpackaged files (pyc, pyo) halted the build. - added defines

Change-Id: I405aafe5df8a5955cb9f23bcca34037d557bae63

These fixes use a different way from Grizzly fix, so it is a direct patch for stable/folsom. I hope it can be backported but please feel free to decline.
I must apologize it is not a usual path.

Thanks, Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-04-10 08:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Sorry for the patch at this moment.

The controller which has this bug is NEC PFC (ProgrammableFlow Controller). 
Without this patch, PFC except the newest version recently released cannot be 
used with Quantum and this means most versions used cannot be used. 
Now we apply this patch locally to use Quantum with these versions of PFC. 
Customers using not-newest versions of PFC begin to deploy OpenStack
but they still prefer to Folsom even though Grizzly is released.

> Looking at the code, the patch seems to make us ignore the ID returned
> from the POST and use the network ID instead. In that case,
> how does update/delete_network/port() functions still work as expected?

In the REST API of the controller (PFC), there are two mode:
- When a network ID is not passed in the request of network creation, the network controller assigns a network ID internally and returns  the assigned ID to Quantum (The network ID assigned is unique in the tenant). 
- When a network ID is passed in the request, the network controller uses the passed ID 
as a network ID (after checking its uniqueness) and does not return a network in the response.

The first mode is used just because the network ID is a human-friendly string.
This patch changes the plugin to use the latter mode. In the latter mode, the network ID is not included in the response and the controller ensure the passed ID is used if it returns 200 as a response code. Thus update/delete_network/port() work as expected.

Finally, I apologize the patch at this moment and understand your concern if it is not accepted.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 08:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

stable/folsom is frozen for 2012.2.4, so this would be an exception to the freeze. See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-April/007273.html


The idea is that the stable branch is a "safe source of fixes for high-impact, user-visible issues". So, this close to the release, we are very conservative. It's hard for me to judge how serious this bug is and how risky the fix is. Can you explain?


Looking at the code, the patch seems to make us ignore the ID returned from the POST and use the network ID instead. In that case, how does update/delete_network/port() functions still work as expected?

commit_message:
plugin/nec: Make sure resources on OFC is globally unique.

V3 and V4 of NEC ProgrammableFlow controller (PFC) generates a network ID
unique inside a tenant. On the other hand, ID mapping table in NEC plugin
expects ID on OFC is globally unique. As a result creation of a network
will fail. To fix it, quantum network ID is passed as ID on OFC.
The same issue happens in port creation too.

In Grizzly this bug was fixed in another way (to support shared network),
but this change is quite big and it cannot be backported.
The minimum way to fix this bug is to specify OFC network ID from Quantum.

Since V3 of PFC does not return network/port ID in the response when ID is
passed in the request, create_network/port is changed to return an ID
passed to the controller instead of extracting ID from the response.

Fixes bug #1127664

Change-Id: Iad1961ee2469b547598e87e63a4a3dc4ac9c6e97

commit_message:
Adding a running method to the Backup Model

* Adds a query classmethod to Base Model for
  more complex queries such 'in_'
* Adds a running classmethod to Backup Model
  which returns any currently running backups
  for an instance.
* Add a checksum field to the Backup Model.
* Refactor the DBBackup to reuse base methods

Change-Id: Iaf6903af88c7f4caa20921f1ca63354999ec6348

commit_message:
heat templates : Update Wordpress config for F18 guests

F18 contains apache 2.4 which requires a different syntax to enable
non-local access to the wordpress install

fixes bug #1166897

Change-Id: Ia63cceeba35904f05a1b4cf76fc075d3cdc7cd86

[{'created': '2013-04-10 06:28:54.000000000', 'message': "Allow pdb debugging in manually-invoked tests.

 * The old behavior required setting environment variables to
   disable capture of stdout and stderr to allow debugging via pdb.
   The new behavior requires enabling capture of stdout/stderr
   instead. This is already the case in nova.
 * testr behavior is unmodified.
 * Tip 'o the hat to Robert Collins (lifeless)

Change-Id: Ica021eeab07d5a540ce42436c9cc8000c3fd239a
"}, {'created': '2013-04-10 06:28:54.000000000', 'message': "Enable pdb debugging in tests by default.

 * The old behavior required setting environment variables to
   disable capture of stdout and stderr in testing to allow
   debugging via pdb.  The new behavior requires enabling capture
   of stdout/stderr instead. This is already the case in nova.
 * Top 'o the hat to Robert Collins (lifeless)

Change-Id: Ica021eeab07d5a540ce42436c9cc8000c3fd239a
"}]
commit_message:
Allow pdb debugging in manually-invoked tests.

 * The old behavior required setting environment variables to
   disable capture of stdout and stderr to allow debugging via pdb.
   The new behavior requires enabling capture of stdout/stderr
   instead. This is already the case in nova.
 * testr behavior is unmodified.
 * Tip 'o the hat to Robert Collins (lifeless)

Change-Id: Ica021eeab07d5a540ce42436c9cc8000c3fd239a

commit_message:
Make use of simplejson in the transport layer.

simplejson is strictly compatible with the standard json library
(for example, the big integer support), and use a C backend to boost
the performance.

Change-Id: I7ba0b8b5fa7bcadde5c6e88654bad1e08ccde11a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-01 13:05:14.000000000', 'message': "Enable admin to associate network with any project

Current api extension networks only can add network to admin his own project,
because it get project_id from context.project_id, which is filled by keystone
according to the token. So this fix extracts project_id from the request body,
along with the network id. And if the project_id is not provided in the body,
it will use context.project_id. This fix doesn't change the old behaviour,
neither the request url format, but can provide the convenient way to associate network to any project.

Change-Id: I9e8aeb5ef84a1a5c053555bf0cc974f4b8b3d7f3
Fixes: Bug #1161441
"}]
commit_message:
Enable admin to associate network with any project

Current api extension networks only can add network to admin his own project,
because it get project_id from context.project_id, which is filled by keystone
according to the token. So this fix extracts project_id from the request body,
along with the network id. And if the project_id is not provided in the body,
it will use context.project_id. This fix doesn't change the old behaviour,
neither the request url format, but can provide the convenient way to associate network to any project.

Change-Id: I9e8aeb5ef84a1a5c053555bf0cc974f4b8b3d7f3
Fixes: Bug #1161441

[{'created': '2013-04-10 01:16:16.000000000', 'message': 'Read from multiple metadata sources.

Heat writes the initial metadata for a server to
/var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data. heat-cfntools will read remote
metadata and if it is updated, copy it to /tmp/last_metadata. So we need
to read from that location first, and then the initial static location.

Because this file is in /tmp, special care is taken to make sure we are
only reading from files that are writable by whoever we are running as,
or root (usually that will be the same two users).

Change-Id: Ida17453c88a2ac400367283f2fb6871a1a0a544f

commit_message:
Read from multiple metadata sources.

Heat writes the initial metadata for a server to
/var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data. heat-cfntools will read remote
metadata and if it is updated, copy it to /tmp/last_metadata. So we need
to read from that location first, and then the initial static location.

Because this file is in /tmp, special care is taken to make sure we are
only reading from files that are writable by whoever we are running as,
or root (usually that will be the same two users).

Change-Id: Ida17453c88a2ac400367283f2fb6871a1a0a544f

The assumption to make is that plugin that mixes in the DB mixin has to call super's create_security_group_rule, which leads to create_security_group_rule_bulk() in SecurityGroupDbMixin.

commit_message:
Populate default SG rules through plugin methods

SG rules that are created upon SG creation be created
directly through DB models. Therefore, the plugin
wouldn't have a chance to handle the rules. This patch fixes it.

Fixes bug 1156504

Change-Id: I01d6f27f42d2d19ddb0835f71547e5103aecd94f

commit_message:
Run 'keystone db_sync' as keystone user.

Running db_sync as root can cause permissions issues due to the fact
that the keystone log file gets owned as root
(/var/log/keystone/keystone.log).

This makes this module usable when using packages on Fedora 18.

Change-Id: I2c75db61474fb14f898c530bec2e8aad1230ad7c

commit_message:
objects md5-collisions

This patch identifies md5 collisions on objects and sends a 403
from the object server.

Credits for originating this fix are to Michael Factor.

Change-Id: I4f1b32183e2be6bbea56eaff86b9a4c7f440804a
Fix: Bug #1157454

commit_message:
Remove openstack-all element.

openstack-all element is out of date, and has been
superceded by the boot-stack element.

Change-Id: I6c3a3c3302cec0d2e3c0eea354e1f80e922f9d5f

[{'created': '2013-04-04 22:28:53.000000000', 'message': 'Make swift backend not enherit glance::api.

Having the glance::backend::swift class inherit glance::api
makes it unusable (it causes puppet errors due to missing password
which is required by glance::api).

Since this module is mainly just useful to configure sets of
swift configs it can stand on its own.

Change-Id: I549087e2e9e9e1abd43bd0f78e4f4dee71490ace
'}]
commit_message:
Make swift backend not enherit glance::api.

Having the glance::backend::swift class inherit glance::api
makes it unusable (it causes puppet errors due to missing password
which is required by glance::api).

Since this module is mainly just useful to configure sets of
swift configs it can stand on its own.

Change-Id: I549087e2e9e9e1abd43bd0f78e4f4dee71490ace

commit_message:
Remove nova-api element.

nova-api has become out of date.

It should be replaced by depending on the 'nova' element,
and using os-svc-daemon to install a nova-api start script.

Change-Id: Ied84c385e80a702a61ae51d45765aa9e65f614d4

commit_message:
Adding help text to the options that did not have it.

Many of the config options did not have help text set.  This patch
adds text for those.

patchset2 adds 5 skipped options

patchset3 adds a missing underscore before the helptext bracket

patchset4 fixes pep8 errors

patchset5 notes the units (seconds) in sql_retry_interval, as noted
by Flavio Percoco Premoli

patchset6 fixes comments from Alex Meade

Fixes bug: 1162449
Change-Id: Ic75e499456e389df2ec527594bbcd54c0b464ee3

catch errors in wsgi.Middleware.

- Catch errors in wsgi.Middleware like done in wsgi.Applications.
- Add tests for test_middleware.
- Fixes bug 1128379.

commit_message:
Generate ssh hostkeys on first-boot.

cloud-init is expected to generate unique hostkeys on first
boot, but sometimes it doesn't.

This change ensures that hostkeys are always generated.
This change should be removed if the cloud-init problem is solved.

Change-Id: I7d7e05fbd12727992cf1aebec547ae0488e002ff

kernels today, so we drop the manual installation of that package, replacing it

commit_message:
Add armhf support.

ARM doesn't have a generic Linux image due to the soc-specific nature of Linux
kernels today, so we drop the manual installation of that package, replacing it
with a dist-upgrade instead. This involved tweaks to the dpkg and fedora
install-package scripts.

Change-Id: I97924b80ca87781307e1087b9fe4b18215770e84

commit_message:
Add err()/err_if_not_set()

* err() and err_if_not_set() do error-like reporting without aborting the script
* die_if_not_set() now properly dies
* add is_running() from Grenade

Change-Id: I38b88112415a3c07e35bbc2dc65ad839c4d63fce

commit_message:
Add Swift Static Large Objects to admin guide

Grizzly brings a new feature to swift - the ability to upload
large objects broken into chunks, unified by a manifest file.
This patch copies the doc from the swift code into the admin
manual.

fixes bug 1153469

Change-Id: Ib3cd45d9d3e2dd8ddd151a5a1acde14639af4b83

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-09 13:03:46.000000000', 'message': 'Catch NoValidHost exception during live-migration

To avoid leaving the instance state as MIGRATING if scheduling of
a target host fails, add this exception to the list of exceptions
for which the instance task state is reset to None.

Resolves bug 1166771.

Change-Id: I23343091725051624c0eb0b82e9f03a7f9d5f4f4
'}]
commit_message:
Catch NoValidHost exception during live-migration

To avoid leaving the instance state as MIGRATING if scheduling of
a target host fails, add this exception to the list of exceptions
for which the instance task state is reset to None.

Resolves bug 1166771.

Change-Id: I23343091725051624c0eb0b82e9f03a7f9d5f4f4

Elizabeth,

  Thanks for all your feedback. I think it has been mostly addressed:

  ssh-key issue:   should be fixed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26435/

  DNS:   "nameserver 8.8.8.8" should now appear in /etc/resolv.conf with the latest patchset, which should cause DNS to work from inside the VM.

  IMAGE_SIZE:  this currently defaults to 10G, which is sufficient for boot-stack in the incubator.git/scripts/boot-elements script.

  READMEs: I would like to hold off on adding boot-stack to top-level READMEs until this change has landed.

  -Tim'}, {'account_id': 6609, 'date': '2013-04-09 17:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

error: Could not load host key: /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key
error: Could not load host key: /etc/ssh/ssh_host_ecdsa_key
fatal: No supported key exchange algorithms [preauth]

Also probably want to update the README.md instructions example to use boot-stack (since bootstrap element has been relplaced). commit_message:
A self-contained one-node baremetal openstack.

The 'boot-stack' element is a self-contained, baremetal openstack.
Upon first boot, it will initialize itself with default keystone
users, nova flavors, etc.

Change-Id: Ib0c411627154a3d666f74513c6b8edfbfbf6c07e

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-03-26 17:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:29:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This makes a change in the assumptions about the REPO and BRANCH variables in that if they happen to be set when stackrc is sourced, their values will not be reset as they are today.  I don't know yet if this is a problem or not but it needs to be checked out.  My primary worry right now is in Grenade, although there are times when stackrc is sourced more than once in DevStack.

I think it will be likely that the only time OS_BRANCH will have the same value for all repos is for 'master'.  Specifically, the clients do not have 'milestone/proposed' or 'stable/grizzly' or whatever.

Also, thus far DevStack does not use any variables prefixed 'OS_', those are generally expected to be consumed by the command-line clients."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Dean: It sounds like the OS_BRANCH is undesirable, so I'll revert that part of the change.   And though I can't see how the changes to repo definition would impact code that wasn't simply terrible, I'll cross my fingers and defer to your superior wisdom."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-04-02 05:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like this change but agree with dean's point how about change it to like this: 

-CEILOMETER_BRANCH=${CEILOMETER_BRANCH:-$OS_BRANCH}
CEILOMETER_BRANCH=${CEILOMETER_BRANCH:-"master"}

etc...'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-02 22:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-02 22:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

   repo overrides.  This change maintains support for individual
   overrides while adding the ability to override GIT_BASE.

   for core projects.

commit_message:
Increase flexibility of stackrc repo config.

 * Offline use of devstack previously required defining individual
   repo overrides.  This change maintains support for individual
   overrides while adding the ability to override GIT_BASE.

Change-Id: I4ca8b8e69c0fb05a7c9cf2fd4643eac2f7643aa9

commit_message:
Add TLS Support for LDAP

Fixes Bug1040115

added several test cases, also provides a full ldap
regression suite. Also added supplemental (simple)
verification for CACERTFILE and CACERTDIR
added a TLS disable option when ldaps URLs are used
and did full regression tests using ldaps URLs
and with TLS
addresses ayoung's comments
addresses dolphm's and Mouad's comments
addresses gyee's doc request and bknudson's comments

Change-Id: I639f2853df0ce5c10ae85b06214b26430d872aca

'}, {'account_id': 1782, 'date': '2013-03-19 16:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Added new manager method to check on remote host if the instance is running on shared storage. As well had to add 3 new driver methods to support it.

I planned to reuse the libvirt.driver._create_shared_storage_test_file method, but it checks the CONF.instances_path instead of instance directory which could be a bug. Same is for _check_shared_storage_test_file and _cleanup_shared_storage_test_file.

The new libvirt.driver.check_instance_shared_storage_local mainly duplicates the libvirt.driver._create_shared_storage_test_file method and i think live migration checks could be refactored to use those methods.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-03-26 18:35:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Evacuated instance disk not deleted

Adds disk cleanup in case instance is not on shared storage.
Added new methods to compute.rpc and virt.driver interface to validate
that instance files located on shared storage on remote compute node.

Fixes bug 1156269

Change-Id: Ia4cc601d0d824ba04f595df96461cfa85ad3b90c

commit_message:
heat : Getting started updates for grizzly

Update GettingStarted to drop references to F16/essex and add the
password sed which is required when running grizzly installed via
tools/openstack on Fedora

Change-Id: I08d265e2e2388b54a6aa9f47c4930c32f71f3e93

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-05 12:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please add some more details as a comment here

Which grizzly change is this backporting?

Are there any bug reports from users who have seen this issue?

Why do you think this is a "high-impact user-visible issue"?

Why do you think the backport doesn't represent a regression risk?

TBH, this looks like a pretty minor issue to me'}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-04-08 05:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-04-08 05:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Which grizzly change is this backporting?
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19189/
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/aba228075d779547f5e866671fadc8e12ef77da2#L5R1333
Unfortunately, the bugfix sneaked in as a part of another big change. 

> Are there any bug reports from users who have seen this issue?
I dont think so, but we faced this issue while testing the driver internally.

> Why do you think this is a "high-impact user-visible issue"?
Without the bugfix, the driver gives the user a false impression that he/she has a 2G volume created out of a 1G snapshot, but in actuality only a 1G volume is created at the backend. This a serious concern IMO as the user will get unexplainable errors when he tries to copy more than 1G data to the volume (because the user thinks the volume is 2G).

> Why do you think the backport doesn't represent a regression risk?
The bugfix is just a condition check, so I dont think it presents a regression risk. We've functionally tested the driver after bugfix and it didnt appear that it affects the other functionalities of the driver.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-08 06:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-04-04 12:40:09.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: dont allow volume from snapshots of different size

This patch disallows creation of volume from snapshot of

commit_message:
NetApp: dont allow volume from snapshots of different size

This patch disallows creation of volume from snapshot of
different size. Previously, it seemingly allowed creation of a volume
from snapshot of different size, but in fact, created the volume
of the same size as that of the snapshot

Fixes bug 1164473

Change-Id: Id35175d23baf5f5f19db4fe3968a96f980fcaa65

commit_message:
Fix a bad tearDown method in test_quantumv2.py.

Cleanup code runs in LIFO order, so this was calling the mox methods
in the wrong order. Secondly the whole point of addCleanup is to
register code to run as soon as it is known that it should run, vs
tearDown which only runs if setUp succeeds, and doesn't know what
other code completed.

Change-Id: Iff3b91e9d43cc58b667b32cacc4b97b6e0e1f298

[{'created': '2013-04-09 13:44:22.000000000', 'message': "Security groups may be unavailable

Currently all missing security group situations are reported as errors
and exceptions. This is not the case - any user requesting a wrong id
or name can cause it and it's not an issue in Nova. A busy system can
generate a large number of those messages causing unnecessarily high
error count.

This change stops reporting this situation as exception in the logs.

Change-Id: Ide856cbbde2db025b0e2def79652cc6c9b00566b
"}]
commit_message:
Security groups may be unavailable

Currently all missing security group situations are reported as errors
and exceptions. This is not the case - any user requesting a wrong id
or name can cause it and it's not an issue in Nova. A busy system can
generate a large number of those messages causing unnecessarily high
error count.

This change stops reporting this situation as exception in the logs.

Change-Id: Ide856cbbde2db025b0e2def79652cc6c9b00566b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-09 04:56:25.000000000', 'message': 'Linux Mint support

This patch allows DevStack installation on Linux Mint. Installations
on Linux Mint previously failed since its distribution ID did not
match any of the package installation methods and defaulted to using
rpm packages. Linux Mint is a Ubuntu derivative and such does not have
native support for rpm packages.

This change adds "LinuxMint" to the distribution matching options along
with Debian and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ice6a201cabe07373a9c1354699777835addeac53
Fixes: bug #1166422
'}]
commit_message:
Linux Mint support

This patch allows DevStack installation on Linux Mint. Installations
on Linux Mint previously failed since its distribution ID did not
match any of the package installation methods and defaulted to using
rpm packages. Linux Mint is a Ubuntu derivative and such does not have
native support for rpm packages.

This change adds "LinuxMint" to the distribution matching options along
with Debian and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ice6a201cabe07373a9c1354699777835addeac53
Fixes: bug #1166422

commit_message:
Set swift3 before s3token in proxy server middleware pipeline

swift3 and s3token middlewares were not set in correct order in
/etc/swift/proxy-server.conf when the swift3 service is enabled
with keystone. swift3 must be set before s3token.

Fixes: bug #1166123
Change-Id: I97c051af95cbdc26ccfe9753c5719394e1875dde

Update to the lastest loopingcall from oslo.

This needs threadgroup as well, as it uses loopingcall.

commit_message:
libvirt: Get driver type from base image type.

If we are using the raw backend (no cow), we should set the driver
type based on the type of the source image instead of always
using raw.

Calls to to_xml were moved after _create_image so that the image
type could be determined when creating the xml for libvirt.

Fixes bug 1163009

Change-Id: Ic8d5f0ab83d868a42f834d39c0afb64818d7e027

commit_message:
Optimise to_primitive common cases

to_primitive included many checks that were executed before any usual
types have been checked. It's safe to reorder / duplicate the most
common ones. Especially built-in types can be checked before other
more complicated scenarios. This is important since to_primitive gets
called over a million times in usual test run and many more times in a
live environment.

This change strips around 4% of nova testing time on my machine and the
function itself is ~5x faster on average according to the profiler.

Change-Id: I71e0c06bbcc31793a1cdcebb36d4e3d8c5876f73

commit_message:
heat : cloudwatch paste.ini credentials incorrect

The cloudwatch paste config should specify service/heat
like the other API services, not admin/admin

Change-Id: I0590c88edd6b544aba467ab171dd7f610b50c380

commit_message:
heat tools : openstack script fixes for grizzly

Update tools/openstack so it works with the grizzly preview repo
(tested on F18 with both grizzly repo and folsom distro packages)

fixes bug #1164605

Change-Id: I347a53c9be677131dad37f9fbeb1ed5eb9cb810b

It's time when Folsom was cut.

to get "nova --version" to work properly again

Fixes LP# 1165325

commit_message:
Finds dependencies of configured modules for update.py

Looks up import lines in the configures modules and finds dependencies.
Did not load modules since it seemed as an overkill

Fixes bug #963509

Change-Id: I690cdf6fb149bbe243add3a35b96f6045ebe10f4

commit_message:
Import nova's looping call.

The looping call implementation had drifted in nova away from what
was in oslo. Update olso. I will move nova over to this code in a
later review.

Change-Id: I0e9214a150223dcd4fb1d695db36961bba794166

update devstack instructions for cinder

update devstack documentation to include instructions on how to
enable cinder notifications

fix docstring in volume notifications to say volume instead of compute

[{'created': '2013-04-09 06:19:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix for Cisco plugin physical device config error

This patch fixes a bug with the Cisco plugin where subsequent vlan id's
would overwrite the existing trunking config on a switch interface.

Change-Id: I5e97c00062f687838e60e5dc9470f4a62289676b
Fixes: Bug #1161946
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for Cisco plugin physical device config error

This patch fixes a bug with the Cisco plugin where subsequent vlan id's
would overwrite the existing trunking config on a switch interface.

Change-Id: I5e97c00062f687838e60e5dc9470f4a62289676b
Fixes: Bug #1161946

subject: Make "multi_host" True when it is setted 'T' in network_create
messages:
[{'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-29 04:25:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You need to pass --multi_host=True not ='T' . I believe this bug is invalid."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-29 04:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think that the server should raise invalid input in this case though as T is not a bool.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-29 04:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/23834 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-nova-docs/18121 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-nova-python26/19529 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-nova-python26-rhel6/280 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-nova-python27/19617 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/10970 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/10686 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/16583 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25686/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/9984 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-03-29 04:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Aaron,

Thank you for your comment. The "multi_host" option can be assigned to 'T/F' which is written in the help message.
So I think this bug should be fixed.
And this bug is already reviewed in another patch.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25605/'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-29 06:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

I see: dest="multi_host",metavar="<'T'|'F'>", I think we should just change the client help message instead to be <True|False>.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-29 07:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

or the client to y|n as y is defined in https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/utils.py#L870'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-30 01:02:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Aaron's suggestions"}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-04-01 09:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi,
A network can also be created by the "nova-manage network create", and this command has the same option "--multi_host <'T'|'F'>". But it works properly when the "--multi_host=T" is assigned in the "nova-manage network create". So to fix this bug I think we should change the source but not the help message.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-04-01 16:27:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This should be fixed in novaclient, no need to support 'T' on the server side."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-09 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-09 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-29 03:56:27.000000000', 'message': 'Make "multi_host" True when it is setted 'T' in network_create

Fixes bug 1161297
Even if creating a network with the "--multi_host=T", the "multi_host"
property of the new network is still "False".
This is because nova server interprets 'T' to "False".
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I26ff5139ad82f5c8b71d85fafec2b8aadd5f43ff
'}]
commit_message:
Make "multi_host" True when it is setted 'T' in network_create

Fixes bug 1161297
Even if creating a network with the "--multi_host=T", the "multi_host"
property of the new network is still "False".
This is because nova server interprets 'T' to "False".
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I26ff5139ad82f5c8b71d85fafec2b8aadd5f43ff

commit_message:
Change timeout in .testr.conf

Increase the value of OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=60 to 100 for opportunistic tests
that take longer than 60 for mysql.

Change-Id: I077bc43a0804a336830ba128c97853d35cc61433
Fixes: bug #1105284

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-29 17:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Can this be solved using the instance actions extension that was added in grizzly?'}, {'account_id': 4340, 'date': '2013-03-29 18:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Russell: No, it wont be solved by instance-action as far as i am aware, it will tell you what happened, ie resize happened, but the purpose of this is not to tell you that, we already know resize happened but would like to know source_compute, dest_compute involved, we also want to know (old/new) flavor..etc. Basically we want a quick view of migrations that has happened for this instance to make troubleshooting any problem easier.'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-29 18:30:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Instance actions won't solve this directly, but it could be extended slightly to handle it.  What I should have added, and could be added in now, would be a free form field to the InstanceActionsEvent model which could store useful information specific to the event being recorded.  It would mean a couple of api calls to get this information but would be a more general solution to this type of problem."}, {'account_id': 4340, 'date': '2013-03-29 18:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Andrew, yeah i agree we can add new fields to instance Event to hold info like this in general, but i prefer this over that (probably also because this is already here :) ) because coming from ops side of things i can say that there are a lot of migration relates issues admins deal with daily and i want it as easy as possible. Most of the time i want to see not just the current resize information but also information on resizes before, and its a bit of work to dig through actions events for this info especially if the instance in question have other actions in between. I think this ext has a valid use case, but if everyone feels that adding it to instance-actions is a better way to go, then i am happy to abandon this. Thanks guys.'}, {'account_id': 4340, 'date': '2013-03-29 20:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I looked at adding this info to instance-action, and seems to me that we'd have to add the same info that is already present in migrations multiple times (to taken into consideration status change) in action events to get this info back to the user.
Also, and this is probably very pertinent is that a lot of the times admins directly modify the db when there are resizes that error and are not able to revert through revert api call. So these changes wont be captured by action events, and its important that we see this.

thoughts ?"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-29 21:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The duplicated data is a fair point that I don't have a great response for.  But I would point out that storing it with the event would provide some flexibility around how it's stored, so you could have a model of it intended for admin consumption versus the current model intended for the internal workings of Nova.

But what I really want to address is your second point.  If admins are modifying the db directly then there are issues that needs to be fixed in the code and hopefully there are open bug reports for them.  Finding a different way to expose data because the current mechanisms wouldn't account for outside modification seems to be the wrong approach, I would much rather see outside modification made unnecessary.

All that being said, I think it would be nice to extend a mechanism that's already in place for exposing internal information to admins but understand that it may not always be the best route."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-01 12:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, I did not mean to suggest that instance actions already did the same thing as this.  I wanted to explore whether instance actions could be extended to solve the use case here.

I just feel like instance actions is already the general solution we've started with to answer the question of "what has happened to instance X".  If we need to expose some more detail about particular operations, then looking at extending that would be nice.

It seems like we may have cases where we want to expose more data in instance action history to admins than regular users.

Since this review is turning into a design discussion, I suggest that the discussion move to the openstack-dev list, which is a more appropriate place for a discussion at that level.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-01 12:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, I did not mean to suggest that instance actions already did the same thing as this.  I wanted to explore whether instance actions could be extended to solve the use case here.

I just feel like instance actions is already the general solution we've started with to answer the question of "what has happened to instance X".  If we need to expose some more detail about particular operations, then looking at extending that would be nice.

It seems like we may have cases where we want to expose more data in instance action history to admins than regular users.

Since this review is turning into a design discussion, I suggest that the discussion move to the openstack-dev list, which is a more appropriate place for a discussion at that level.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-04-01 20:35:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with everything Russell said."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-09 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-09 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
API extension for instance migration history

Adds a new API extenstion to access migration history
information for given instance.

Admins are frequently in need to access migration related
data and the only way to do this right now is to go to the
db. This extension attempts to solve that by providing a simple
way to list migration history for a given instance.

Implements blueprint bp-migration-history-ext
DocImpact

Change-Id: I43e30e84dda07448d5deef6a6983569f687aa4e5

but since those are from an external project, can't really fix that
here, logged at:

commit_message:
Move auth info api-paste.ini -> nova.conf.sample

Move keystone authentication fields from etc/nova/api-paste.ini to
etc/nova/nova.conf.sample.

It is easier on operators if only the nova.conf file needs to be
edited, and seeing this content in etc/nova/api-paste.ini is
confusing.

Modified tools/conf/extract_opts.py to support module name as a
command-line argument, since the keystone auth options are defined
in the keystoneclient module.

Modified tools/conf/generate_sample.sh to pass the relevant module
name that contains the keystone_auth parameters:
"keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

Fixes bug 1161165

Change-Id: I805160cd4089cb220ff64158e5bb44eeb9413ced

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25863/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/11182 : SUCCESS As best as we can tell this change works.
- http://logs.openstack.org/25863/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/10898 : SUCCESS Postgres users everywhere thank you.
- http://logs.openstack.org/25863/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/16842 : SUCCESS The bits must flow.

commit_message:
Add ovs_use_veth True for lbaas agent nicira and ryu plugin

The nicira and ryu plugin require ovs_use_veth True with their interface driver.

Change-Id: I89fe8d413424b413bd2022bb087eea6eec3fa243

Oh, don't get me wrong, after having used eventlet now, I really dislike it. It takes a lot of effort to get it right especially given the benefit of it.

You're right that it *should* be fine since all calls to sqlalchemy will do a yield and all calls via RPC will implicitly yield during network I/O.

I want to look at a few more things first to make sure I understand all of the possible code paths and yields are happening correctly before I give this a +2."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-03-30 22:08:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

100% agree. The more of these special 'sleeps' we can remove the better. Especially now that we have fixed sqlalchemy, it'd be nice to move toward things which work with greenthread and which also work without it. Since py3 is on the horizon someday and eventlet might just get left in the dust...."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-04-01 20:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

We have not 'fixed sqlalchemy'.  See inline.  I'd say yields are necessary until there's an eventlet release that works properly... AND that we've enabled thread pooling by default.  I tend to like the explicit yields in methods that do not matter how long they run, anyway.  I don't see anything wrong with explicitly giving up processor time."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-04-01 21:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Start to hide the usage of greenthread.sleep in compute.manager.

Instead of exposing the inner details of greenthread in for loops
we should attempt to start to remove said special cases and hide our
usage of greenthreads (between each iteration for yielding purposes) so
that later in the future it becomes easier to change the leaky greenthread
abstraction.

Fixes: bug 1161965
Implements: blueprint hide-greenthreads

Change-Id: I466e0816d2fcffd48202fc300bc5c9e865733398

'}, {'created': '2013-03-26 14:35:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for volume backup-to-swift

'}, {'created': '2013-03-29 19:26:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for volume backup-to-swift

Adds the commands: list-backup, show-backup, create-backup and
delete-backup to both v1 and v2 api versions, since extentions

commit_message:
Add support for volume backup-to-swift

Matches support recently submitted to cinder.

Adds the commands: list-backup, show-backup, create-backup and
delete-backup to both v1 and v2 api versions, since extentions
are available to both.

Change-Id: Ide077018738695be923734c093f944568bfef8f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-08 03:17:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add reset function to nova coverage.

Now nova coverage is standardized to accumulate coverage data.
It enables user to get combined coverage data of several tests.
In addition to it, we need to restart nova services when measuring
coverage of each test because there is no function to reset data.
This adds reset coverage data API.

Fixes bug: 1164331

Change-Id: Idd16cf3849b6510e7c620ed3bf16d507ed44c328
'}]
commit_message:
Add reset function to nova coverage.

Now nova coverage is standardized to accumulate coverage data.
It enables user to get combined coverage data of several tests.
In addition to it, we need to restart nova services when measuring
coverage of each test because there is no function to reset data.
This adds reset coverage data API.

Fixes bug: 1164331

Change-Id: Idd16cf3849b6510e7c620ed3bf16d507ed44c328

This appears to be junk DNA from glance, which has filters
for caching image files.

commit_message:
Remove unused and deprecated auth-context filter

keystone.middleware.auth_token is now just aliased to
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token.

Also heat_auth_token doesn't seem to exist, so this has likely
always been broken

Change-Id: I5eadd9a02e41921b39fc8b6783c22010893bb5e9

commit_message:
Remove nova-vm element.

nova-vm element has become out of date with the
rest of the tripleo system.

It should be replaced by specifying libvirt to the
os-config-applier-able 'nova' element.

Change-Id: I147f5a536ca40f63b2c43b72ea2678c570516215

commit_message:
Small change to exception handling in swift store

Tweak the exception handling when deleting stale chunks from the swift
backend so we don't need to use the sys module or stash the exception.

Addresses bug 1158342.

Change-Id: If83ad04e54e978a25a793fed394a384c15dc3b8a

commit_message:
Remove quantum-api element, for now.

quantum-api element is out of date.

While services will need to break up services soon,
in this case it should be done by depending on 'quantum'
element, and having quantum-api element just drop a
service-start script.

Change-Id: Idbcab2266c40aff0129d5bd4cfa1295571ec8165

commit_message:
Add an extension to show the network id of a virtual interface

This extension adds the OS-EXT-VIF-NET:net_id param
so that users can determine vif plunged into which network now.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I56bef5c45f7f545aa5e9b13760dff1c802da0f8f
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Expands the Boot from Volume documentation.

This commit adds some further information about booting from volumes. It
ensures the features are updated for Grizzly. Also removes a duplicate
section about booting from volumes. Also updates the Ops Guide with this
info.

Change-Id: Iac6a4caa36da388936543c7a3aaed3af1429bdd0
Fixes: bug #1163580

commit_message:
xenapi: /boot/guest should point to local SR

Fixes bug 1037516

This patch creates a directory os-guest-kernels inside the local SR, and
sets up /boot/guest to be a symlink to that directory. This way
OpenStack won't pollute Dom0's filesystem.

Change-Id: If8dfe24355bd782a401fed0f2c4b423efd9c11ba

commit_message:
Update "Getting Started" Contributing docs

As of March 2013, joining the openstack-cla team on Launchpad is no
longer required.

Change-Id: I342f9600c1b6689780086894746de70ea15577a5

commit_message:
Enable automatic validation of many HACKING rules.

 * Add hacking to the tox build - a set of flake8 plugins that
   perform automatic validation of many HACKING.rst rules.
 * This patch configures hacking in the tox build and performs
   the mechanical cleanup required to allow the checks to pass.
 * See https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hacking

Change-Id: Ib41313b5aae991e6ffef2a89dd69e83985bdc36d

[{'created': '2013-04-08 21:38:21.000000000', 'message': 'Correct a unit test failure that crept into trunk

At some point, the "nova list" command started returning an
empty table when no results were obtained, while the
tests.test_shell.ShellTest.test_password test was expecting
a single newline.  Whichever commit caused this change in
behavior somehow made it past the gate without forcing the
test to be updated.

This commit fixes the issue by changing the output that
test_shell.test_password is expecting.

Fixes bug 1166464.

Change-Id: I57636b4a1e525c440925caba0bbb51bbcd94b080
'}]
commit_message:
Correct a unit test failure that crept into trunk

At some point, the "nova list" command started returning an
empty table when no results were obtained, while the
tests.test_shell.ShellTest.test_password test was expecting
a single newline.  Whichever commit caused this change in
behavior somehow made it past the gate without forcing the
test to be updated.

This commit fixes the issue by changing the output that
test_shell.test_password is expecting.

Fixes bug 1166464.

Change-Id: I57636b4a1e525c440925caba0bbb51bbcd94b080

commit_message:
Don't try to smart find packages that aren't there.

We help out by looking for the obvious stuff. But sometimee, like in
git-review, we don't have a package at all.

Change-Id: Ic575c0008c69ffaba43a637b460899dd848d3fd5
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/26289
Reviewed-by: James E. Blair <corvus@inaugust.com>
Approved: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Attempt to delete resources even if they failed

To do otherwise risks leaving resources silently running that exist but
have experienced some kind of error during creation.

Fixes bug 1165023

Change-Id: Ie60fb053b1a596d102ca1b6a8429dd50ed41ff92

'}, {'created': '2013-04-08 10:44:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AccessKey deletion with bad credentials

commit_message:
Fix AccessKey deletion with bad credentials

If an AccessKey could not be created, it also could not be deleted. This
change allows deletion of the resource to proceed even if the user does not
exist.

Fixes bug 1155824

Also fixes a bug that the actual key would never be deleted, because the
resource_id is set to None beforehand.

Change-Id: I34886410e3e25ad62e4eba537063f922b011e25a

commit_message:
Fix xml request doesn't work with unicode

Fix bug 1160704

* httplib2 doesn't work with unicode url and params. So encode all unicode
to utf-8 before request.
* Fix xml serializer doesn't work with unicode
* Decode command argument to unicode in main function
* Exception's message maybe include unicode, decode message to unicode
before logging or print.
* Sync the changing of serializer/deserilizer's code with quantum server code
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25482/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25046/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21410/
* Enable xml test

Change-Id: Ib140e34d54cc916e2ea172e4bad9e4a77388723a

commit_message:
Pass metadata port to metadata proxy

Make the l3 agent pass the port used by the metadata service to the router namespace proxy when
creating it and add also new tests for this.

Fixes LP# 1160955
Change-Id: Iec8a5238345b26e70b0aa1dc96a896e26af34722

commit_message:
RestClient:keystone_auth hides requests and errors

RestClient::keystone_auth did not logged requests/responses and instead
 of reporting unexpected status codes it silently returned None.
(Which causes 'NoneType is not iterrable' for example for HTTP 500)

Also removed setting of unused variable tenant_id.

commit_message:
xenapi:live-block-migration - fix XML client test

Fixes bug 1161356

KeyError: 'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host' was raised while testing the live block
migration. This patch overrides the host detection in the XML client
case.

Change-Id: I90638d5b4a908171472611c4da5c5d915979ea6a

[{'created': '2013-04-01 16:45:10.000000000', 'message': "Add testresources and testscenarios.

Now that we're on testtools/testr in places, we can start using
testresources and testscenarios to optimize our test suites a bit.

testresources allows for declarative fixture creation in such a way that
an optimizing test suite can group tests that need an expensive-to-set-up
fixture together and use a reset method on the fixture between tests.

testscenarios allows for declarations of combinations of inputs and outputs
to a single tests, which can greatly simplify large amounts of repetitive
code that's trying to grab coverage of option sets.

Change-Id: I834813071c519086f06f80bf418c949bbc47c0ab
"}, {'created': '2013-04-07 06:07:27.000000000', 'message': "Add testresources and testscenarios.

Now that we're on testtools/testr in places, we can start using
testresources and testscenarios to optimize our test suites a bit.

testresources allows for declarative fixture creation in such a way that
an optimizing test suite can group tests that need an expensive-to-set-up
fixture together and use a reset method on the fixture between tests.

testscenarios allows for declarations of combinations of inputs and outputs
to a single tests, which can greatly simplify large amounts of repetitive
code that's trying to grab coverage of option sets.

Change-Id: I834813071c519086f06f80bf418c949bbc47c0ab
"}]
commit_message:
Add testresources and testscenarios.

Now that we're on testtools/testr in places, we can start using
testresources and testscenarios to optimize our test suites a bit.

testresources allows for declarative fixture creation in such a way that
an optimizing test suite can group tests that need an expensive-to-set-up
fixture together and use a reset method on the fixture between tests.

testscenarios allows for declarations of combinations of inputs and outputs
to a single tests, which can greatly simplify large amounts of repetitive
code that's trying to grab coverage of option sets.

Change-Id: I834813071c519086f06f80bf418c949bbc47c0ab

[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-05-03 20:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-05-04 02:19:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

My initial concern is that we now have multiple interfaces for performing the same actions, which is what I was trying to avoid. I'll need to look through this more..."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-05-04 10:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

I like the look of it.

One tiny suggestion around ordered test numbering.

I don't like the idea of ordered tests, but I think they make a lot of sense in this case.

I don't like the idea of testing the same operation two ways, but it is important to test the CLI for the smoke tests.

The argument to test methods again by calling the API directly is weaker, but I can see that being useful, if we have the effort to maintain it."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-05-14 16:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-05-21 04:01:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Refactoring of base test case classes

* Splits out the "manager" class into its own file (at least
  for now to keep the code change size down initially)
* Adds base manager classes for Fuzz and Default clients
* Adds base test case class and a derived base SmokeTest class
* Adds smoke test for basic server operations in compute
* Adds non-smoke test for advanced server operations in compute

Change-Id: Ib87da825f05550d625a08aa1fe82bfaa921e80f9

[{'created': '2013-04-07 04:25:01.000000000', 'message': 'nova-consoleauth start failed by consoleauth_manager option missing 

Miss onsoleauth_manager option importing caused nova-consoleauth service
start failure: "NoSuchOptError: no such option: consoleauth_manager".

Fixes bug: 1164845

Change-Id: I59a15a423f49ee6c28401f905b4973c2231faaa6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>'}]
commit_message:
nova-consoleauth start failed by consoleauth_manager option missing 

Miss onsoleauth_manager option importing caused nova-consoleauth service
start failure: "NoSuchOptError: no such option: consoleauth_manager".

Fixes bug: 1164845

Change-Id: I59a15a423f49ee6c28401f905b4973c2231faaa6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

"}, {'created': '2013-04-06 07:16:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix typo for run_tests.sh -S option

commit_message:
Fix typo for run_tests.sh -S option

This patch fixes a typo of getopt's arguments. If the second 's' option letter
is not 'S', -S option is not recognized.

Fix bug 1161921

Change-Id: I0b5a372e7257b9319b350131303c1a9f51b57eb5

commit_message:
Use baremetal-interface-add, not baremetal-add-interface

Since nova doesn't have such subcommand.

Instead make it configurable as part of the backup_swift_url option

commit_message:
Add custom TableFormater for keep same empty list behavior as prettytable 0.6

Fix bug 1165962

And upgrade cliff to 1.3.2, because cliff 1.3.1 depends on prettytable<0.7

Change-Id: I6b38a2d77f6b9bf88d6d64f6c02b98b6c21fda3a

commit_message:
Add tests for adding/removing flavor access

* Adding/removing flavor access with admin privileges work.
* Raise Unauthorized exception when adding/removing flavor access
  without admin privileges.

Fixes bug: 1161774

Change-Id: I0b5e8b3835385fb3cb3a984779ef9cc5cb495549

chore: Remove bin/marconi-self-host

This directory is no longer necessary, and the script is out of
date. marconi/bin is the new home for this sort of stuff.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 21:06:01.000000000', 'message': "Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.

If the call to the driver to resume an instance raises an exception,
then nova-compute fails to start properly. This can happen during
recovery, for example, where an instance has been deleted so the
backing files are gone but the database is restored to a state
where it exists.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and setting
the instance to error.

Fixes bug 1100430

Change-Id: Ie31f39fcd43174c29bf7a5cb1b6fa29e4c723f97
"}]
commit_message:
Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.

If the call to the driver to resume an instance raises an exception,
then nova-compute fails to start properly. This can happen during
recovery, for example, where an instance has been deleted so the
backing files are gone but the database is restored to a state
where it exists.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and setting
the instance to error.

Fixes bug 1100430

Change-Id: Ie31f39fcd43174c29bf7a5cb1b6fa29e4c723f97

commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I2b5c56dbf941b272bd89b0dbe6f651196d90944f

Looks like this is a step backward. bin/oslo-rootwrap was, in effect, part of the "rootwrap" module. It was in sync with the rest of the rootwrap module, and ready to be separated out. With your suggested change, it's now part of a "cmd" module, which may or may not be synced separately from the rootwrap module (imagine someone wants the latest oslo-rpc-zmq-receiver and syncs cmd).

Remember the goal of oslo-incubator is to grow independent libraries, and rootwrap should move as a standalone module soon enough. With that goal in mind, keeping the script in bin/ (and the config files in etc/) doesn't sound bad at all.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-04-04 14:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Move bin/ scripts to entrypoints.

Instead of propogating more bin scripts, migrate these to be things
that can be consumed as entrypoints.

Change-Id: Ic01e0f16fe9e7634708fbb51499ccea3f4f40d63

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 14:04:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some not-consistent titles for virtual routers management

- Replace "Detail" by "Details"
- Replace "Create a router" by "Create router" (like other OpenStack projects)

Fix bug #1120551

Change-Id: I8b6e01b4400a044dfab7322abb251fe034ae010b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some not-consistent titles for virtual routers management

- Replace "Detail" by "Details"
- Replace "Create a router" by "Create router" (like other OpenStack projects)

Fix bug #1120551

Change-Id: I8b6e01b4400a044dfab7322abb251fe034ae010b

Thanks Nachi for testing.

I missed your first comment. The issue you pointed exists before my patch. I'll also fix it in the patch.
The cause is that required=False is specified to subnet_id field. It must be True since subnet_id is required. The same thing applies to SetGateway.

Regarding QuantumClientException, perhaps you seemed to use devstack default local_settings.py. When using the file exceptions from API client cannot be handled properly. You need to use openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example as local_settings.py. After that, I believe appropriate error message is displayed."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-06 10:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-06 10:58:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 14:24:38.000000000', 'message': 'Allow users to create a rich network topology

Fixes bug 1146926

This commit enables Quantum Router support to create a router interface
with a specified IP address. Previously we can connect one network (subnet)
to only one router and a topology we can create is limited.
By this commit we can connect one network to multiple routers and
create a rich network topology through Dashboard.

Change-Id: Ifb90f70a4468fdf4e8ba356080cd0333f10e595f
'}, {'created': '2013-03-05 18:10:22.000000000', 'message': 'Allow users to create a rich network topology

Fixes bug 1146926

This commit enables Quantum Router support to create a router interface

commit_message:
Allow users to create a rich network topology

Fixes bug 1146926

This commit enables Quantum Router support to create a router
interface with a specified IP address. Previously we can connect
one network (subnet) to only one router and a topology we can create
is limited. By this commit we can connect one network to multiple
routers and create a rich network topology through Dashboard.

This commit also fixes the folowing bugs:
* subnet_id in "Add Interface" form and network_id in "Set Gateway"
  form should be required=True since they are required fields.
* An error message is display twice when the above two forms.

Change-Id: Ifb90f70a4468fdf4e8ba356080cd0333f10e595f

commit_message:
refactor _get_sync_routers to use get_routers.

By using get_routers, get_sync_data() can get all attributes
including attributes provided by extensions which extend router ext.

Change-Id: I4be761dadd18eed19f4e54676e77d99bcc4a4745

Good patch, but I agree with Dan."}, {'account_id': 4340, 'date': '2013-04-01 20:47:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I believe list calls for admin are in the format:
nova list --all-tenant --{filter} (dont think its documented though)
such that if you called --tenant like so:
nova list --all-tenant --tenant xxxxxx would work.

the filter i guess is doing the same; only placing project_id with context.project if only if you dont specify all-tenant search opt.

The patch looks good, i am -1 only because this particular call would deviate from other calls like ip or host etc. which also follow the format
nova list --all-tenant --ip xx.xx.xx.xx
Having said that i am ok if everyone find this to be better in terms of handing tenant_id in list call."}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-01 21:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Looking at this unit test (https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py#L720) I would say it's working by accident and not on purpose.

IMHO, filtering by ip/host/etc is orthogonal to filtering by tenant id (or not filtering by tenant id in case if `all_tenants` is set). I'd work if you didn't set the `all_tenants` flag, but it would implicitly filter instances by admin tenant id of course."}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-02 09:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-02 12:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-02 12:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-02 12:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25541/4/check/gate-nova-pep8/23952 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25541/4/check/gate-nova-docs/18225 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25541/4/check/gate-nova-python26/19633 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25541/4/check/gate-nova-python26-rhel6/348 : SUCCESS (non-voting)

- http://logs.openstack.org/25541/4/check/gate-nova-pylint/10052 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4601, 'date': '2013-04-02 14:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-04-03 08:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

This breaks current behavior where people are using all_tenants=1&tenant_id=foo.  This query would now always return all tenants, from what I can tell and ignore the tenant_id filter.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-03 09:11:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Are we sure that's correct behaviour?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-04-05 16:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Debatable. :)  When you're admin, things get weird.  By default, you don't want to show all instances for all tenants.  You only want to show the admin's instances.  If you were to only provide a tenant_id filter in this case, it seems like it should actually just be ignored... or it should filter and show no instances.  The 'all_tenants' thing was intended to be the trigger to say "Ok, I'm actually interested in all tenants" but a tenant_id filter along with that modifies it to only include the 1 tenant you care about.

I think I am okay with this change... but I think that we should allow the old way to work until after H is released.  Ie, find some way to mark it as deprecated and allow it to continue to function through the H release.  (If we decide we really want to change this)'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-04-05 16:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

After thinking more.  It just does seem weird that all_tenants=1&tenant_id=foo completely ignores the tenant_id filter.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-08 08:07:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Abandoned

This change breaks existing behavior which is supposed to be right. I think it's time to abandon the change and mark the bug as invalid."}]

commit_message:
Fix processing of filters when listing instances

The method for listing of instances maps request filter names to
correct attribute names of DB models. Both "project_id" (one that
is equal to the id of a tenant that makes a request) and "tenant_id"
(one that is used for filtering of instances which belong to the given
tenant) filters map to the same entry in the resulting filters dict, so
one of them will eventually be overwritten. Ensure we have only one
of these filters.

Fixes bug 1134382.

Change-Id: Ic391ff5f8b073f00284aabeafee3d5ec53744309

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-05 14:04:12.000000000', 'message': "Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error

Don't see any reason to construct a list for request_spec['volume_id'].
And it indeed causes problems when the scheduler receives a reschedule
request with such a request_spec.

Fixes bug #1164857

Change-Id: I811e957d5bf9c814165d55ea0042833ea72c8de5
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed a volume creation re-schedule error

Don't see any reason to construct a list for request_spec['volume_id'].
And it indeed causes problems when the scheduler receives a reschedule
request with such a request_spec.

Fixes bug #1164857

Change-Id: I811e957d5bf9c814165d55ea0042833ea72c8de5

commit_message:
leave re-scheduled volume status to creating

A re-scheduled volume should not be exported and set to available

Fixes bug #1159027

Change-Id: Ie61d9132ce1bd6461d5e4d9836424ebf14100389

commit_message:
Move keystone auth from api-paste.ini to nova.conf

Remove keystone authentication from api-paste.ini and add it to
nova.conf instead

This is needed to address bug 1161165

Change-Id: I6331705407de40658562b65585eccca53f4f360a

commit_message:
Remove race condition (in InstanceTypeProjects)

Soft delete all duplicate rows with the same (project_id, instance_type_id)
except one with the biggest value in `id` column.

Create UC on columns (project_id, instance_type_id, deleted)

Add tests for migration

Fix instance_type_access_add method
	Replace Select then Insert -> Try to Insert.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Id70509337e78f3bf778501f2c77aa03263580ef0

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I3085f841c1d0a934502b3563a9ad01f885b3fe08
"}]
commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I3085f841c1d0a934502b3563a9ad01f885b3fe08

commit_message:
Prevent create volume from snapshot with bad size

Prevent to create a volume from a snapshot with a volume size less
than the snapshot size.

Check if a volume size is specified that it is less than
the snapshot size.

Raise a exception if it's lesser.

Fixes bug 1161841

Change-Id: Ic1afbfb025ce0b3906c35c6c50a71734d74a9851

commit_message:
Remove unused and deprecated auth-context filter

keystone.middleware.auth_token is now just aliased to
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token.

Also heat_auth_token doesn't seem to exist, so this has likely
always been broken

Change-Id: Ic6d1fef6de155a56e7259114ecfd63a67352de8c

commit_message:
Set a default signing_dir for pki key signing

Without this, PKI token authentication doesn't work.

Devstack will set this value to /var/cache/heat

Change-Id: I6dcdd8759158fc9a97b6109d6790eaf85413d846

commit_message:
Move heat-api auth_token conf from paste.ini

keystone auth_token middleware now allows heat to have auth_token
configuration in heat-api.conf. This commit moves the example of
auth_token configuration from heat-api-paste.ini to heat-api.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit heat-api-paste.ini.

This change does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/heat/heat-api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already uses heat-api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

Blueprint: keystone-middleware
Change-Id: Ic83de18d2d7351671568f1536761d1f198f8eb49

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-05 02:18:26.000000000', 'message': "Replace old auth_token with keystone middleware

The context filter was relying on our modified auth_token setting
these non-standard headers:
- X-Admin-User
- X-Admin-Pass
- X-Admin-Tenant-Name
- X-Auth-Url

There is now nothing in heat-engine which uses service_user, service_password
and service_tenant so I've removed them from the request context. If it turns
out we need these in the future I'd rather they be set directly in
heat-engine.conf rather than being sent over the (controller network) wire
for every request.

The new auth_token sets a header with a full service catalog, so currently
auth_url is set from this service catalog. Alternatively the whole service
catalog could be put in the RequestContext, which would mean one less call
to keystone in token-only requests.

Change-Id: Iee28c32f7b1fa57aad0b750a3a7df8b71c6e94c2
"}, {'created': '2013-04-05 02:27:10.000000000', 'message': "Replace old auth_token with keystone middleware

commit_message:
Replace old auth_token with keystone middleware

The context filter was relying on our modified auth_token setting
these non-standard headers:
- X-Admin-User
- X-Admin-Pass
- X-Admin-Tenant-Name
- X-Auth-Url

There is now nothing in heat-engine which uses service_user, service_password
and service_tenant so I've removed them from the request context. If it turns
out we need these in the future I'd rather they be set directly in
heat-engine.conf rather than being sent over the (controller network) wire
for every request.

The new auth_token sets a header with a full service catalog, so currently
auth_url is set from this service catalog. Alternatively the whole service
catalog could be put in the RequestContext, which would mean one less call
to keystone in token-only requests.

Blueprint: keystone-middleware
Change-Id: Iee28c32f7b1fa57aad0b750a3a7df8b71c6e94c2

The test_preattach_status_volume test was failing due to state left by
another test. The interim solution was to skip the aforementioned test.
I tracked down the problem to 4 tests in test_admin_actions.py that
call self.start_service('volume', host='test'), and don't stop the
service. Stopping it in all 4 tests solves the problem.

HOWEVER, I don't know why these started services caused this particular
test to fail. I am still working to figure that out, but maybe someone
has an idea.

Change-Id: I2a5caaae9f61e7c7617c934917a10cf1cf3c0db6
Fixes: bug 1153108
