commit_message:
Clean up started volume services in tests.

The test_preattach_status_volume test was failing due to state left by
another test. The interim solution was to skip the aforementioned test.
I tracked down the problem to 4 tests in test_admin_actions.py that
call self.start_service('volume', host='test'), and don't stop the
service. Stopping it in all 4 tests solves the problem.

HOWEVER, I don't know why these started services caused this particular
test to fail. I am still working to figure that out, but maybe someone
has an idea.

Change-Id: I2a5caaae9f61e7c7617c934917a10cf1cf3c0db6
Fixes: bug 1153108

This commit fixes some issues in AttachInterfacesTest.
* There is a problem to get the return value, TypeError is
  occurring.
* Assign the JSON or XML to _interface, but it is not specified
  in the method.
* Add a process to wait until the "ACTIVE" status.
  Because the status is "DOWN" when a interface is created.

Fixes bug 1164894

'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttachInterfacesTest error

This commit fixes some issues in AttachInterfacesTest.
* There is a problem to get the return value, TypeError is
  occurring.
* Assign the JSON or XML to _interface, but it is not specified
  in the method.
* Add a process to wait until the "ACTIVE" status.
  Because the status is "DOWN" when a interface is created.

Fixes bug 1164894

Change-Id: I91bec388d2e1e4fcf792d486545f007e50001e73

commit_message:
Wrap eventlet imports in a helper.

All of this is because if dnspython is present in your environment then
eventlet monkeypatches socket.getaddrinfo() with an implementation
which doesn't work for IPv6. What we're checking here is that the magic
environment variable was set when the import happened.

Resolves bug 1164822.

Change-Id: Idf84e705a6d0f27c521f04bd3ad22e89e9b9d274

[{'created': '2013-04-05 09:47:03.000000000', 'message': "Allow deletion of backups where the service is None

If a backup is created while both cinder-backup and rabbitmq
are not running, backup records are created in the database with a
service entry of None.

There is no actual backup data created on the service, since the service
isn't running. This fix allows removal of these records without an error
when a delete backup request is received.

This fix also ensures backup status is set to error in the event of
an exception during a delete.

Fixes bug #1162908

Change-Id: I5771747a00a70621f7cc101f8c1da2f613e83cdf
"}, {'created': '2013-04-05 10:38:39.000000000', 'message': "Allow deletion of backups where the service is None

If a backup is created while both cinder-backup and rabbitmq
are not running, backup records are created in the database with a
service entry of None.

There is no actual backup data created on the service, since the service
isn't running. This fix allows removal of these records without an error
when a delete backup request is received.

This fix also ensures backup status is set to error in the event of
an exception during a delete.

Fixes bug #1162908

Change-Id: I5771747a00a70621f7cc101f8c1da2f613e83cdf
"}]
commit_message:
Allow deletion of backups where the service is None

If a backup is created while both cinder-backup and rabbitmq
are not running, backup records are created in the database with a
service entry of None.

There is no actual backup data created on the service, since the service
isn't running. This fix allows removal of these records without an error
when a delete backup request is received.

This fix also ensures backup status is set to error in the event of
an exception during a delete.

Fixes bug #1162908

Change-Id: I5771747a00a70621f7cc101f8c1da2f613e83cdf

Exclude top level 'tests dir' from packages.

In 8fbe6d we moved 'tests' to be top level. As such it makes
since to now exclude it from quantumclient packages.

subject: Fix e2fsck/resize2fs path
messages:
[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-29 18:17:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Are you running the compute-manager as root? That should have /sbin in the PATH."}, {'account_id': 7170, 'date': '2013-03-29 18:22:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not running n-cpu as root, it is a basic principle that avoid root as you can"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-29 18:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/23858 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-nova-docs/18144 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-nova-python26/19552 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-nova-python26-rhel6/295 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-nova-python27/19640 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/11031 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/10747 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/16657 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25740/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/9999 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-29 19:58:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Removing the -1 so others are more inclined to look at it.

I'm curious why this is just being reported now, we have lots of places all over the codebase (especially in virt.xenapi) where we shell out to /sbin binaries without an absolute path.

`parted`, `tune2fs`,  `mkswap` just to name a few.

Any ideas what's different here?"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-29 19:59:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So resize2fs is called both as root and not.

Now for normal users on most systems /sbin (and /usr/sbin) are in the path. Since Fedora 10 for example, and I checked a RHEL 6.1 system which also had resize2fs available in the default user path.

What systems are you testing on?"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-29 20:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note my specific reason for -1 is that /usr/sbin/resize2fs is used on newer Fedora systems'}, {'account_id': 7170, 'date': '2013-03-29 20:15:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm using Debian sid.

So we need a new `execute` method to find it in /sbin /usr/sbin ?"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-29 20:29:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There is already a standard method on systems to search a set of PATHS. IMHO the debian packaging should add /sbin to the PATH of the nova user in its packaging.

Pushing PATH searching/specification higher up the stack doesn't make much sense. There are very few commands with full paths specified in nova and they should probably be changed to just use the command name."}, {'account_id': 7170, 'date': '2013-03-29 21:35:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The path environment variable of standard linux distro doesn't include /sbin:/usr/sbin, only a few distro modified path for convenience. Whether to include sbin in path also depends on user preference.

Beside this, to solve the problem, we'd better make it configurable. I suggest improving the rootwrap to handle this situation, force every exec go through rootwrap and allow user to config his preferred programs. If this solution is acceptable, I can begin next week."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-29 22:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So if you force run_as_root=True, rootwrap will already do as you want if you have exec_dirs setup in your rootwrap.conf

There are overheads and security implications of running as root though so it would be good to avoid that for platforms that hold on to the misguided /sbin/ /bin split'}, {'account_id': 7170, 'date': '2013-03-29 22:57:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I dont mean run as root, instead I mean using rootwrap but don't use sudo. rootwrap is like a tool to control how to call external programs"}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-03-31 00:47:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I dont think this is the proper fix you should be able to update the rootwrap filters with this change."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-07 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-07 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-29 18:02:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix e2fsck/resize2fs path

Only ubuntu auto search /sbin/ for executes, all other linux platform will
not able to create any instance due to can't execute the command

Change-Id: I7eeaee915d20f4f278b87f77c309f0f6aaec16e5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix e2fsck/resize2fs path

Only ubuntu auto search /sbin/ for executes, all other linux platform will
not able to create any instance due to can't execute the command

Change-Id: I7eeaee915d20f4f278b87f77c309f0f6aaec16e5

commit_message:
Implement get_volume_stats for GlusterFS driver

Implement get_volume_stats(), so that the GlusterFS driver
will work correctly with the scheduler.

Fixes bug: 1164038

Change-Id: Ib4db8bad897212227b39704e2e6cb5f07f2bb70e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-31 09:54:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add acknowledgements to compute-adminguide

The bug mentioned is above removing a by-line. It turns out that
the section the by-line applies to has been updated quite a bit from
the original. So, the proposal is to remove it and add a mention
in an acknowledgements section at the end of the document.

Feedback very welcome.

fixes bug 1035675

Change-Id: I392d1c0b74fc2cb9c647e47fed44186d1faf355b
'}]
commit_message:
Add acknowledgements to compute-adminguide

The bug mentioned is above removing a by-line. It turns out that
the section the by-line applies to has been updated quite a bit from
the original. So, the proposal is to remove it and add a mention
in an acknowledgements section at the end of the document.

Feedback very welcome.

fixes bug 1035675

Change-Id: I392d1c0b74fc2cb9c647e47fed44186d1faf355b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-05 14:54:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove update_volume_status log message from NFS driver

The manager logs an INFO message when this action occurs already,
and it not called by anyone else, so don't log twice:

INFO [cinder.volume.manager] Updating volume status
DEBUG [cinder.volume.drivers.nfs] Updating volume status

Change-Id: Id99be0c0e50837c2b59963d983b9a7db3d25919a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove update_volume_status log message from NFS driver

The manager logs an INFO message when this action occurs already,
and it not called by anyone else, so don't log twice:

INFO [cinder.volume.manager] Updating volume status
DEBUG [cinder.volume.drivers.nfs] Updating volume status

Change-Id: Id99be0c0e50837c2b59963d983b9a7db3d25919a

commit_message:
Adpated to nova's gettext changes.

Resolve the failure of nova_notifier unit test due to the gettext
changes in nova.

This is part of the blueprint gettext-i18n-issue.

Change-Id: I4dc1404fbd401bf2f33b64cb9a963eeaa3796ebd

[{'created': '2013-04-03 10:48:04.000000000', 'message': 'Correct network uuid field for os-network extension 

nova net-list not return network uuid but id instead even uuid
available. "network_dict" function in the extension should not use "in"
checking for a Network model object. This also caused API miss forward
compatibility.

Fixes bug: 1162409

Change-Id: I30d4c8bfa37d89123f35ee8cc7c67f0e819262a7
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>'}, {'created': '2013-04-05 14:08:30.000000000', 'message': 'Correct network uuid field for os-network extension 

"nova net-list" does not return network uuid even when the uuid is
available, and instead returns only the id. This is because the
"network_dict" function in the extension improperly uses "in" to check
for a Network model object. This also reduces compatibility in the API.

Fixes bug: 1162409

Change-Id: I30d4c8bfa37d89123f35ee8cc7c67f0e819262a7
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>'}]
commit_message:
Correct network uuid field for os-network extension 

"nova net-list" does not return network uuid even when the uuid is
available, and instead returns only the id. This is because the
"network_dict" function in the extension improperly uses "in" to check
for a Network model object. This also reduces compatibility in the API.

Fixes bug: 1162409

Change-Id: I30d4c8bfa37d89123f35ee8cc7c67f0e819262a7
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

[{'created': '2013-04-06 20:43:00.000000000', 'message': "Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I64dff89639f9d136ded3d25aab9f8f85a2d7112b
"}]
commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I64dff89639f9d136ded3d25aab9f8f85a2d7112b

commit_message:
Support for Dictionary Options

Allow key/pair options that result in dictionary. Works
similar to ListOpt

    option = key1:value, key2:value

Adopted tests from ListOpt to build the
set of test cases for DictOpt

Change-Id: Id832bfee575a0bf50747f7d6c2d504c1ccf99323

commit_message:
stop using time.sleep in tests

we use timeutils.utcnow so that we have an overridable clock just like
in the big leagues, making tests literally sleep just slows us down

Change-Id: I8522aef1fab39a3370448bce779ca69d8f5e07b5

commit_message:
A self-contained one-node baremetal openstack.

The 'boot-stack' element is a self-contained, baremetal openstack.
Upon first boot, it will initialize itself with default keystone
users, nova flavors, etc.

Change-Id: Ib0c411627154a3d666f74513c6b8edfbfbf6c07e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 04:03:46.000000000', 'message': 'Pass os_options auth_token to keystone client

A call to swiftclient.client.get_keystoneclient_2_0 will fail in the following
scenario:
auth_token is set in os_options
swift endpoint is unknown so an authenticated service catalog call is required

The problem is that the auth_token is not passed to the keystone client create
call, so this will only work with a password.

Change-Id: I684f9bdfc008a9181d18d6835375145395e4722d
Fixes: bug #1160172
'}]
commit_message:
Pass os_options auth_token to keystone client

A call to swiftclient.client.get_keystoneclient_2_0 will fail in the following
scenario:
auth_token is set in os_options
swift endpoint is unknown so an authenticated service catalog call is required

The problem is that the auth_token is not passed to the keystone client create
call, so this will only work with a password.

Change-Id: I684f9bdfc008a9181d18d6835375145395e4722d
Fixes: bug #1160172

Unfortunately, it won't be easy/possible to test the new code path without adding something like the envelope argument to force sending replies in a different fashion. That seems like a much bigger change.

This patch should either skip adding tests for now, grow much bigger, or get split up. I'm somewhat partial to just skipping tests, since the missing test coverage is *already* missing. [{'created': '2013-03-27 01:54:35.000000000', 'message': 'ZMQ: Improves Logging for for rpc method timeouts

This feature was introduced for AMQP drivers
per commit 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8

Works towards: bug #1148516

Change-Id: I0d60c99b50c729ae570a0616193eca7cfcfd60d8
'}, {'created': '2013-03-27 13:26:02.000000000', 'message': 'ZMQ: Improves Logging for for rpc method timeouts

For ZeroMQ, supports the changes introduced by the previous
patch for "improved logging for rpc method timeouts"
which introduced a method and topic into the Timeout exception.

This feature was introduced for AMQP drivers
per commit 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8

Works towards: bug #1148516

Change-Id: I0d60c99b50c729ae570a0616193eca7cfcfd60d8
'}, {'created': '2013-03-27 14:39:57.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor exception/type handling for cast/call

For ZeroMQ, supports the changes introduced by the previous
patch for "improved logging for rpc method timeouts"
which introduced a method and topic into the Timeout exception.
This feature was introduced for AMQP drivers
per commit 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8

Additionally, per suggestion by Zhongyue Luo,
I took this as an opportunity to also refactor the exception
handling for _cast/_call altogether, where it appeared there
were at least a couple minor bugs. The exception handling
is now better concentrated and granular.

- Deserialization was happening within the context
  of the Timeout, which was incorrect and mildy dangerous.
- The code did not catch the case that a response was not a
  dictionary.
- Invalid messages were raised as RPCException, but these are
  now better handled as UnsupportedRpcEnvelopeVersion.

The _call() method now understands receiving non-dictionary
responses, which will allow for further optimization come
the I release (as we could then eliminate -process_reply)

Debug logging statements have also been cleaned up slightly
to remove some redundancy and increase clarity / consistency.

Works towards: bug #1148516

Change-Id: I0d60c99b50c729ae570a0616193eca7cfcfd60d8
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor exception/type handling for cast/call

For ZeroMQ, supports the changes introduced by the previous
patch for "improved logging for rpc method timeouts"
which introduced a method and topic into the Timeout exception.
This feature was introduced for AMQP drivers
per commit 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8

Additionally, per suggestion by Zhongyue Luo,
I took this as an opportunity to also refactor the exception
handling for _cast/_call altogether, where it appeared there
were at least a couple minor bugs. The exception handling
is now better concentrated and granular.

- Deserialization was happening within the context
  of the Timeout, which was incorrect and mildy dangerous.
- The code did not catch the case that a response was not a
  dictionary.
- Invalid messages were raised as RPCException, but these are
  now better handled as UnsupportedRpcEnvelopeVersion.

The _call() method now understands receiving non-dictionary
responses, which will allow for further optimization come
the I release (as we could then eliminate -process_reply)

Debug logging statements have also been cleaned up slightly
to remove some redundancy and increase clarity / consistency.

Works towards: bug #1148516

Change-Id: I0d60c99b50c729ae570a0616193eca7cfcfd60d8

commit_message:
Use auto-deleted queues prevent rpc flood

fix bug 1157771

Currently we use 'call' instead of 'cast' for prevent rpc flood. But
'call' doesn't scale. We can use auto-delete queue that will be
deleted automatically after quantum server stop, then all messages
send to quantum server will be dropped.

The oslo patch at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24904/

Change-Id: I008bc01613f5408e018557f370d49a772a7c2ef7

commit_message:
user.find by name should use the existing API functions

This makes the user retrieval operation a lot more efficient
e.g. vs. loading all the users from an LDAP backend when doing
operations on a single user.

Change-Id: I09e0a93f05428347d2b15ced824e549b1e210f88

[{'created': '2013-04-05 23:51:08.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to flake8 from pep8.

 * flake8 supports more checks than pep8 (e.g. detection of
   unused imports and variables), and has an extension mechanism.
   A plugin to support automatic HACKING validation is planned.
 * See: http://flake8.readthedocs.org/

Change-Id: I1cba551fadf87f3dbc40a002736c1009e7b9d5b5

commit_message:
Switch to flake8 from pep8.

 * flake8 supports more checks than pep8 (e.g. detection of
   unused imports and variables), and has an extension mechanism.
   A plugin to support automatic HACKING validation is planned.
 * See: http://flake8.readthedocs.org/

Change-Id: I1cba551fadf87f3dbc40a002736c1009e7b9d5b5
